Reviews.Author: Marianne
Reviews.Content: I love Tea Time! So great to have a good boba place in the North West area instead of having to drive to China Town.   The owners are very friendly & can suggest popular and tasty drinks if you haven't been here before. I usually get the strawberry pudding w/ boba or the strawberry mango smoothie with boba & mango jelly stars. Both super yummy!   They have a wide variety of tea flavors, smoothie, flavors, topping and even food. Food is pretty good. Popcorn chicken is good and so is the ramen. Perfect for a rainy or cold day.  I've also had the fish balls but I'd suggest eating them there cause they didn't taste as good when I brought them home.   All in all this place is a cute place to sit and have a drink or snack. Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: Yum.  honey lemon drink is super tasty

Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: First time here & last time! Customer service lacks as well as the workers choice of clothing...cover up please!  Was not welcomed as we came in & were obvious first timers but offered no help or suggestions. Had Iced Strawberry Green Tea.....very bitter. Yakisoba fries okay but really salty. Would not put milk in a cup for my daughter which I was willing to pay for. Dirty floors....dirty chairs & tables while about 5 workers stand around.

Reviews.Author: Katherine
Reviews.Content: I ordered Chai tea with boba, yakisoba fries, and takoyaki.  Chai tea was almost bland, however the tapioca pearls were soft and perfect.  Food took near 15 mins to wait on.  Yakisoba fries were so so good, until my second fry in was when I noticed there was a hair in my food. I returned it, and after 5 more mins of waiting,  one of the employees did apologize, however they could not offer to remake another batch of yakisoba fries because they ran out of ingredients. They ended up refunding me with another apology.  The takoyaki was soggy and drowning in bulldog sauce, making the entire thing tok salty to eat.  I didn't finish any of the items that I have ordered and waited so long for. I'm not even going to think of giving this place anymore of my business. First time, and last time.

Reviews.Author: Taylor
Reviews.Content: I can walk into Tea Time, and they will know my name and ask if I want  the usual.  I've been a regular customer for probably about three years now. This place is the most amazing tea place I have ever been to! The staff is friendly and inviting, and they are more than willing to help you out if you need some advice on what to order. I LOVE the Peppermint Milk Green Tea, and I'm addicted to the French Macarons! My boyfriend loves the Mocha Smoothie, and he will get mad if I go and don't bring him anything! They are still changing their menu and coming up with new and exciting things to share with its customers. I go to Tea Time constantly and always will. I highly recommend this cute little place, and you should too!

Reviews.Author: Sela
Reviews.Content: Variety of boba drinks and Japanese/hawaiian style meals and snacks. Tha place is pleasant, cozy, and clean unlike typical boba places in Chinatown.  I believe this is the only boba place (real Asian-tasted desserts and not just a chain place that use super sugary powder mix) in the Northwest. Will be making frequent stops here! 5 stars!

Reviews.Author: Xavier
Reviews.Content: Been going there for over 6 mnths now and it is still the best I have ever tasted!  I used to go to Lee's sandwich to get it, but this one just taste so much more natural and so much more flavorful, plus after your 10th, you get one free. Coconut smoothie with Booba is the truth!

Reviews.Author: Jon And Chey
Reviews.Content: I have gone to this place several times, and becoming a regular despite of 1 order incident, everything after has been a great experience.. Ken and Richie are awesome! I love the macaroons, boba and I always order the chicken curry katsu here when I stop by! They care about their customers! Keep a friendly caring environment staff! You'll see more of me!

Reviews.Author: Camille
Reviews.Content: Y'all are the bossmen. I'm glad that this is located in North LV and not in China Town because they've got enough boba places. They also have other alternatives like lychee, instead of getting boba with your tea. Free wifi always warms my heart up, and they have BRICK TOAST AND JENGA. I EFFING LOVE JENGA.

Reviews.Author: babii
Reviews.Content: Go here for bobas. They have a lot of different flavors and they also have coffee too. They also have macaroons and they are really delicious but pricey. Their bobas is inconsistent tho, depending on who is making it, they will put too much ice and it'll be too icey and I even found a whole piece of ice in it too . But they have good bobas on the north side of town most of the time :)

Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: First off I have to start by saying I LOVE how friendly they are here!! They make it so easy to not be afraid to try new things! They gave my whole family samples and although I am already not afraid to try anything they tell me is yummy, they are slowly converting my family into tea fans too! If you have any questions at all, they will explain them all, even if it's the whole entire menu! So don't be afraid to order out side of your normal realm when you go here.   I had the Taro Smoothie with Boba and it was delicious! It tasted like Lucky Charms marshmallow's! The only thing I would have changed was the size, it was just too large for me to finish.   They also gave me a punch card, so I will be back to work on my free drink very soon. It was such a great change from my Starbucks routine!

Reviews.Author: Shannon
Reviews.Content: Somehow I had no idea this place was here. I thought it was new and asked the guys how long they have been open and they said 2 years. Darn, I've been missing out, but not anymore!  The service is super great, friendly, and have great customer service.  Milk tea with boba was delicious with just the right amount of ice to keep it cold, but not watered down. I'm excited to try their food and other drinks.  Will definitely be back instead of driving to chinatown for a boba fix.

Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: Smoothies with boba!!!  The best thing to do with boba is to shoot them out of the straw at people, it sticks!    But this place is actually good!  I'm very impressed, especially with the location being out in the northwest of the Las Vegas valley.  If you're a smoothie fan, smoothie boba fan, this is a must stop at least once visit!  Can I call this place a mom and pop shop?  Or should I just call this a Vegas gem instead?  Whatever, it's good.  They'll make it to your satisfaction also.  They'll pour out a little bit into a cup and have you sample your selection to see if it's just right, too sweet, not flavorful, or simply not right and will make it for you again.  So far in my experience they've hit the ball out of the ballpark each time.  They also have stamp cards so you can build up stamps and earn a free drink after so many stamps.  I haven't tried the food yet but the smoothies alone gets a high rating from me.

Reviews.Author: Floren
Reviews.Content: VERY SLOWWWW! SERVICE! Took over 30 minutes for three drinks! RIDICULOUS!!! I don't get it! I watch 3 people walked in after us and got out earlier. Crazy! Crazy! Crazy! Watch Out People! And to the Owners, You have to improve the Customer Service aspect of your Business or else you will Loose it!

Reviews.Author: Kara
Reviews.Content: I really love this place. The only reason it doesn't get five stars is because five stars indicates perfection to me, and it's not quite perfect.  Pros 1) They have just about any kind of tea, slushie, or smoothie you can imagine and you can add boba to it. $3.50 for a regular, and $4.50 for a large (with boba) 2) They have ramen. Enough said. 3) They have donburi. I did not try it this time, but I plan to next time. 4) The ramen portion was huge. I had to have them bag it up for me. They even separated the noodles and the broth so the noodles wouldn't get too soggy. They clearly have my undying love just for this. 5) The pork in the tonkotsu ramen was fantastic. 6) Free wifi. 7) Workers were so friendly and helpful. They didn't make me feel like I was inconveniencing them because I chose to stay there for three hours to get some work done. 8) Prices were great. I got ramen (which I didn't finish) and a large Thai milk tea with boba for under $12.   Cons 1) The tonkotsu ramen broth was nothing to write home about.  2) Loud people came in groups that could be annoying if one wanted to use the place to study. Same with the smoothie machine. 3) Lighting could be better.  In short, they have all the things I love in Japanese express food with reasonable prices, an atmosphere more or less suitable for camping out with a laptop and and an endless pile of books, and free wifi.   If only I had found this place sooner.

Reviews.Author: Regina
Reviews.Content: Superior drinks. Coming from the OC its hard to find a good milk tea. Got a lavender milk tea on this trip. Boba balls were okay but the tea was way yummy. Sad it's so far north. Love that they do free drink rewards too.

Reviews.Author: Jayne
Reviews.Content: Happy to say that I'm a regular at this great tea cafe. I've tried boba tea at several locations in Las Vegas, and this place serves as the hidden gem of North West Las Vegas. The boba itself is always the perfect consistency and the varieties of tea here will not disappoint. Funnily enough, I almost always end up getting the mango green tea. The customer service is great, the people who work here are kind and personable. The food here is also great and more than reasonably priced. I just can't say enough good things about this place.

Reviews.Author: Gwennan
Reviews.Content: Ok coffee but not worth the wait. Extremely slow--single person working took several people's orders before starting to make my order.  Made the cappuccino (which is misspelled on their menu) with too much milk and too hot of water, and didn't understand my complaint...but to be fair did remake my drink (still not good).

Reviews.Author: Briana
Reviews.Content: Being a UNLV student, I am always on the hunt for prospective study venues.  Starbucks is waaay too loud, It's a Grind is too small, and any other place is just not conducive to getting down and dirty with the books.  This is where Tea Time Cafe comes in to save the day!  It's quiet, the tables are large, and the food and drinks are beyond FABULOUS!  I usually either get the milk tea ($3.25) or the lychee smoothie ($3.95). Both are equally addicting!  The food is good too.  Try the onigiri rice balls and the shaker fries - YUM!  Also the pricing here is reasonable (Tea Station charges $4 something for their tea!) and the service is fast and friendly!      So, all in all, this place ROCKS!  If you live on this side of town (or not) you should come and check this place out and revel in their boba-ey awesomeness.  Bring your computer and study materials while you're at it.

Reviews.Author: Yumi
Reviews.Content: Came here for lunch, looking off the popcorn chicken over rice but it's no longer on the menu.  This place is definitely no good for a meal, BUT great for tea time (hence the name) and lounge with friends over some snacks.  The two guys are super friendly!!  Knowing it was my first time, they have me a sip to try what I ordered before making it to make sure I was satisfied.  Love the attention to detail and service!!  Btw, I ordered the spam musubi and it was ok...just hard to eat.  The honey milk tea was perfectly sweet former who doesn't like things too sweet :)

Reviews.Author: Tara
Reviews.Content: To have the boba just sitting out on the counter is beyond me. Scooping it out into the smoothies itself in front of customers is really not reassuring either. Taro smoothie DOES NOT taste like taro you would get in China town, so be ware. I have't tried any other flavors but I seriously doubt that they have consistency. The place seems friendly and laid back, but, If you want the real stuff, that's actually fresh and quality tasting, make the trip over to China Town. Don't settle for this wanna be place.

Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: When I was a kid, I never won prizes out of the claw machine. I used to give my tokens to my uncle because he was pretty good at it. Today, I grabbed this cute little kuma with the claw at Tea Time after one try! My daughter watched and she thinks I'm a winner, plus she got a cute strawberry bear toy that looks like the bowl she threw on the floor at Sweets Raku. My husband is good at winning this game, so he could probably clean out the machine with $20.  The guys at Tea Time Cafe make so many great drinks. There has to be at least 50 options on the menu. They have every flavor except black sesame. Almond milk tea is my standard order, but Thai tea, chai, honeydew, and peach-passion fruit slush are other favorites. Today, I cashed in my stamp card complete with ten punches for a free large pina colada yogurt smoothie with boba and egg pudding. I was pretty much on a winning streak. I almost drove to Primm and bought lottery tickets. The egg pudding was really good, too. The mixed jello drinks look interesting so I will have to order one.  Service is very friendly! If I'm in a hurry or in need of a pick me up on my way to work, I will call in my drink order and it is always ready when I arrive. The claw machine was dark when I was trying to feed it a dollar, so the nice guy turned it on for us. I also bought the tiniest Domo figurine out of a four quarters machine.  Prices are fair, with all drinks costing under $5. The sweet butter brick toast is caramelized like creme brulee and so good! There's a lot more on the menu, but that's all I've tried. I see a lot of people ordering Spam musubi. If your usual boba spot doesn't have arcade games and Domo toys, you should come here instead. If your usual boba spot doesn't have a stamp card, you're wasting money. If you live in the NW, you should definitely try Tea Time Cafe!

Reviews.Author: Racheal
Reviews.Content: They have great bobas. Diverse as well, quick and nice service, and hardly ever packed.  Not much more you can ask for.

Reviews.Author: Chelsea
Reviews.Content: LOVE THIS PLACE! And I love it even more for the fact that it's located on the North side! It's a cute little place that doesn't get too crowded if you go at the right time of the day and they have a bunch of board games, card games, and books to keep you occupied while you stay and enjoy your food and/or drinks. Whenever I come here with people we always end up staying for hours because we get caught up playing different card games or Jenga or something lol.  Their drinks are so good! They have so many unique flavors and they can do your drink in a variety of ways; slush, blended, got, iced, milk tea, etc. They also have food and snacks you can order. I've tried their tempura curry udon, which wasn't bad at all. But my favorite things to get are their Yakisoba Fries and Takoyaki. Where the hell else can you get good Takoyaki in North Las Vegas?! I applaud Tea Time CafÃ¨ for having items such as Takoyaki, cuttlefish balls, honey toast, and ramen on their menu because there really aren't a lot of places, if any, in Northtown where you can get stuff like that.  I saw a review down there that complained about their service, and I think whoever wrote that must be crazy, because of all the times I've gone there I have NEVER experienced bad customer service. And I have always received my orders in a timely manner.   All in all, I LOVE this place. And I hope they're here to stay. Forever lol.

Reviews.Author: Marichris
Reviews.Content: Great place for a quick fix of boba tea. Especially if you don't want to drive all the way to Chinatown. I'm glad this place is so close to my house! I have been here numerous times and never disappointed.   I usually get the milk teas such as: Almond milk tea (my favorite), Honey milk tea, and since it's the holidays, Peppermint green tea (really addicting!)  Try them out.The owners are super nice and chill.

Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: I'm giving four stars for the drinks. Excellent teas and toppings. Boba, always on point. I'm saddened they no longer offer sushi as it was great alongside my tea. The thai coffee is amazing too. Try the lavender tea with boba. I can't say much for the interior except it needs a total revamping. Great counter area, just needs the guest area to be more inviting, updated and fresh.  I take my tea to go but if the dining area was better, I'd try the other food offerings. Great, friendly staff.

Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: Cute space and great service! My boyfriend and I had iced lattes and macaroons (taro and cookie butter, yummmm!!). Next time we'll probably try something with boba!

Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: Pretty much the only place to get boba in the northwest. Luckily it is fantastic, I always get the thai tea, sooo good!

Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: Finally tried this place out on Saturday after driving by for years! It's nice to have a boba option close to home so that I'm not always having to drive to Chinatown! The staff is quick and my drink was out about a minute after I ordered and paid for it.   I had a large coffee milk tea w/ boba. The drink had a great balance of milk and coffee and actually tasted like real coffee vs artificial flavoring. It also wasn't overly sweet as I have heard from other Yelpers. The boba was soft and chewy and not undercooked like most other boba spots. If anything their boba might have been a little on the overcooked side but not by much. They also serve sushi, macarons, and other snacks but I didn't try any because we had just eaten next door. Will be back for some more drinks here!

Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: Thai tea frappe boba! MMMM...the outside of this place looks super sketchy, but the inside is nice enough and the boba is good. They have a small selection of food (expensive food) too, and the macaroons look nice even though I've been too scared to spend money on one. They have a rewards program so after 10 bobas you get one free!

Reviews.Author: Rose
Reviews.Content: When I lived on this side of town we used to visit whenever we craved boba! I love that this place is still up and running! The quality of their drinks are really good! The staff is exceptionally helpful and really friendly. That's a huge plus! The establishment has never been dirty. And the decor is so cute! I recommend this place if you're on this side and are craving boba! You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Author: Munchies
Reviews.Content: Hands down the BEST Boba/tea spot without having to go to Chinatown. It's right off the 95 and Ann. We ordered a lychee smoothie with yogurt & lychee jelly, and an avocado smoothie! Delicious!!! We will be back!

Reviews.Author: Thomas
Reviews.Content: TLDR: menu variety; cheaper add-ons; limited hours and food; plentiful selection; games available   Tea Time Cafe attempts to provide a modern atmosphere with its decor and ambience. While it appears to be a work in progress, the restaurant does seem to have a handle on how to make great tasting drinks at a fair price.   I ordered the leather boba milk tea to determine the quality of the product since it was my first time going. My partner in crime decides to get the ever-popular Thai tea slush. The boba had a consistent flavor and texture. The milk tea was blandly flavorful (how's that for an oxymoron), but seemed delightful. I would appreciate more concentration of tea. The Thai tea slush was almost to die for...the flavor was on-point and plentiful from start to finish.   All-in-all it was a good experience. They frown upon pictures for some odd reason, but I had to sneak a pic anyway. Service was standard, but they didn't offer a stamp card. Wouldn't you want repeat business? I would return only if in the area.

Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: This popped up when I was searching for coffee. No espresso drinks served here, it is a tea cafe only. I do think the had some food on the menu, not sure. Wide selection of teas n chai. The coffee was fresh (I watched him brew it In a drip machine using Kirkland coffee) The service was excellent. But $3.50 for drip coffee is a bit much, I even supplied the cup. I gave him 4 stars because I can't ding him since he went out of his way to make me coffee when they don't even normally sell coffee. So, I guess my review only serves to remind folks to pay more attention before committing to a restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: I drive across town for this place! Best aloe! Best meals! Best boba!  Best customer service! Just out  right amazing

Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. Reasonably priced delicious boba drinks in the Northwest, and amazing service? Count me in.  I ordered an unconventional flavor combination - Honeydew/Peach - and the staff made sure I tried a sample before they finished pouring it for me just in case I didn't like it. I did, but they let me know that if a customer doesn't like a drink they order, they'll always remake it for them. Satisfaction guaranteed :)  Friendly staff, amazing service, great drinks, and a super clean atmosphere with free WiFi? I'm in.

Reviews.Author: Corinna
Reviews.Content: A bit hidden in a corporate business plaza next to Painted Desert golf course. They have a large selection of tea and boba options and flavors. I tried the lychee smoothie. Very yummy. They used to have a larger selection of small food items. Now we just found the ramen intriguing. We tried it. I had tokutsu?. It was a bit weird for my taste. My son had egg noodle and that was delicious. The pic of miso ramen on here looks like it is worth a try in the future too. Will be back, but I do wish they brought back a few more food items like the rice bowls.

Reviews.Author: Alda
Reviews.Content: The white chocolate raspberry macaron is the best! I always got it when I lived in NV and crave it all the time now that I've moved

Reviews.Author: Marco
Reviews.Content: So hard to find good smoothy and coffee spots. Seriously best one in Vegas. Beats Starbucks coffee, and knocks Jamba Juice out of the water.! Will be coming here for ever.!!!

Reviews.Author: Judy
Reviews.Content: So coming back here at a different time, I enjoyed the food and was very satisfied! I order the Thai tea, mango slushy and yaki-soba fries. There boba comes in a large size for such a reasonable price. I realized that the worst time to come for food and macaroons are past 3. I highly recommended this place solely for boba. The yaki-soba fries are pretty good but this isn't the best place for studying/socializing because it can get pretty noisy with the blender.   They have some pretty interesting new subs and they change their macaroon flavors daily. Other than that, the service is pretty friendly like always.

Reviews.Author: Jessika
Reviews.Content: I'd like to propose a toast. To all the perfectly blended smoothies, to the most artistic lattes, the darkest black coffee and to every other beverage who has really made a difference in the life of a human being; whether that be during their 5 am commute to work or late in the evening when nothing but your presence could save them from the worst possible hangover, thank you! Let's give em a hand, everyone!  But seriously.. where would any of us be without our favorite drinks?  Typically, I'm a coffee girl, and normally my hectic schedule requires a few heavy doses of caffeine in order for me to safely get from place to place, but a few too many cups of said coffee yesterday left me wanting anything but this morning.   My boyfriend, Matthew, suggested that a nice cup of tea would be a perfect substitute, and after downing my Earl Grey Milk Tea at the Tea Time Cafe, I might just make this a permanent switch.   Gaaaaahhhhh! That's really all I have to say. The Earl Grey was brewed long enough so that it was strong & potent and it was then cut with enough whole milk to give it a very full bodied flavor. Finished off with just the right amount of sugar, it was everything I needed to start my day off on the right foot! I can't wait for my next cup!

Reviews.Author: Jo
Reviews.Content: I love this place! They have the best boba in town as far as I'm concerned. It's soft and chewy without being mushy. They will make it with less sugar if you want and all of their teas and smoothies are prepared just the way you want. If you don't like it they will make you something else until you are happy. The food menu is simple but very satisfying. The ramen is fresh and delicious and the snacks like spam musubi are tasty. Owned and operated by a family, one of my favorite local businesses. Only complaint is because of the low volume sometimes the food can take a while to come out, but it's worth the wait. And the drinks are usually pretty quick so you have something to tide you over while you wait.

Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: I wish I found this gem of a place earlier! I had no idea there was such good boba tea hidden away in the corner of the Northwest. Highly recommend this place; fast and friendly service, with excellent boba milk teas!

Reviews.Author: aZngyrl
Reviews.Content: Nicely brewed tea and fresh fruit smoothies. Finally found a tea spot that is on this side of town. I don't have to drive to Chinatown for good boba anymore :) I love the green milk tea and sweet butter toast. Simple and delicious!

Reviews.Author: Perry
Reviews.Content: Team time cafe is great. Been going here for years and I am always happy how friendly they are. I like they're new rewards program were u get a free size upgrade for 5 drinks and a free one on your 10th. Boba here is great quality, they take the time to prepare each and every drink so I don't mind waiting because they have books, magazines, and board games to keep you occupied.   Nice decor overall.  I highly recommend the Macarons which are like a sweet desert on the front counter, they perfectly compliment boba drinks and i found myself by a few everytime I visit.  Thanks for being not only in a great convinient location to me, but also for serving a perfected quality of boba!

Reviews.Author: Nikki
Reviews.Content: Located right on 95 & Ann, this cute little spot is one of my favorites to grab a drink & go! A good place to hang out with friends or to get some work done -- has a nice ambiance as well as an extensive drink menu. I personally have not tried any of their food items (yet!), but everything we've tried has been great!  FOR HER: I always tell myself to try their teas, but I have only ordered from their fruit smoothie list thus far because they're so good! I've tried the LYCHEE, HONEYDEW, & CANTOLOPE. All not excessively sweet & very refreshing. I always add extra boba too!   FOR HIM: He's always ordered the same thing. He's a man who sticks to what he knows and he swears by the BROWN SUGAR MILK TEA, with boba too. He loves that you can choose your sweetness level & even request splenda sweetener substitute!   *TIP: Sign up for the  five star  card & get points every time you spend & get text promo coupons for random discounts like free toppings or a percentage off!

Reviews.Author: Brady
Reviews.Content: Yum! So happy to finally give this place a try. The boba in my milk tea was perfectly cooked and the yakisoba fries were amazing! I can't wait to try other things on the menu!

Reviews.Author: L
Reviews.Content: best tea place ever. i am a weekly visitor and they are so friendly and love to make your order just right!!!

Reviews.Author: Maria
Reviews.Content: Rich & Becca are always the nicest. Continually recommending new good drinks.  Since my fav red bean has been taken out :( the games they provide are always fun & this is the only boba place I always come back to.  Clean & quiet: full of families from nearby neighborhoods.

Reviews.Author: Kirsten
Reviews.Content: I've been here twice now and plan to stop by each time I'm up in the area for my chiropractor.  Tasty teas, a variety of options, and friendly service hit the right notes with me.  I also enjoyed their onigiri the first time and plan to try some of their other food offerings soon.

Reviews.Author: Piikea
Reviews.Content: Great cool place to come and get boba!! There are so many great selections to choose from and they even have honey toast here!!

Reviews.Author: Lisette
Reviews.Content: This is usually my favorite place for boba especially since I live in the NW area but lately they have been running out of boba. I've gone here very frequently and i don't know if they changed management but definitely have almost all new employees and maybe the new employees aren't quite  on it  when it comes to making boba. After all, this is a boba tea place and if you're going to run out of boba pretty much everyday and you have customers that have to call in to make sure you have some before driving all the way out there just makes this place less desirable. For the days they do have boba, the quality has gone done tremendously and tastes like they either use the different boba that doesn't taste great as it used to or they are not making it the way it was. Really wish they can make a change/improvement because I will not be coming back for a while because it's a waste of drive for NO BOBA!! :(

Reviews.Author: Gennive
Reviews.Content: So I usually love coming in here and grabbing a smoothie togo but today I decide to have something to eat. I waited for an hr for my food. If I knew it was going to take this long I would of never ordered anything to eat. I doubt I would have mind if I came in here with someone but I just got off work.

Reviews.Author: Francis
Reviews.Content: I only come here for the boba drink. They also offer lots of different drinks and food. I just order a regular size taro boba drink.   Prices here are decent. It's on the north side of Vegas, so I do not have to travel far just to get a boba drink.  I like the inside of the store. Plenty of tables, chairs and a couch. They also have games for you and your friends to play while you wait for your drinks or to hang out.

Reviews.Author: Myra
Reviews.Content: The tea and boba slushy was really good flavor but would never visit again the wait time was really bad 20 min for two drinks and only 2 people in line in front of us when we got there.

Reviews.Author: Sadie
Reviews.Content: Service is always super great. The staff is kind and will answer any questions you may have, they helped recommend me a drink when I was deciding. They are allergy conscious which always nice to know and makes people feel safe. The drinks and food come out quick and fresh! I high recommend trying something new and coming by here. The decorations are also so cute on all the walls. A great study place or just hang out with friends.

Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: I go here often and usually try the taro smoothie with boba. I wanted to try something new and the cashier recommended the strawberry with taro and its amazing!! Every time I go in they recognize me and get me the same order lol.. I love it!

Reviews.Author: Atta
Reviews.Content: Not sure what all the hype is about. Boba tea came out quickly but is mediocre. Food was decent until I found egg shells in the rice. They must not check their food properly. Service was very slow for food.

Reviews.Author: Deon
Reviews.Content: Macaroons, popcorn chicken, and a peach strawberry blueberry smoothie. Macaroons and smoothie are amazingly delicious and refreshing. Not a huge fan of the popcorn chicken has a unique flavor,  just expected something different.

Reviews.Author: Phil
Reviews.Content: Great Boba place in the Northwest. Service was efficient but a little slow because they were extremely busy must be all the good reviews on yelp LOL.  If you want a nice drink with the casual atmosphere this is the place in the Northwest.  As an update to my review sticking with four stars because they typically are out of flavors everything tastes great and they're friendly but they run out too many times

Reviews.Author: Kristie
Reviews.Content: Great place and it's always good but definitely need more staff or more efficiency in executing orders to handle the business coming in. I've been waiting 30 minutes for a milk tea with no boba and I'm still waiting.

Reviews.Author: Jeannette
Reviews.Content: They use to be closed on Tuesday. They are now open on Tuesdays. I'm a happy girl. Everything on the drink menu is pretty good.  I have yet to try any of the food items. Customer Service is good. it can run a little slow only cause everything is made to order.  So be prepared for that.

Reviews.Author: Cilicia
Reviews.Content: The French Macarons there are DELICIOUS! The circus animal and cookie butter..best I've had Mmmm mmm mmm :)

Reviews.Author: Kara
Reviews.Content: Ok why have I not gone to this place sooner! The drink selection is crazy! I got a passion fruit green tea with mango jellies. It was absolutely delicious. They also have macaroons. Um..yes please! Didn't get the fries which everybody rants and raves about but I was able to smell them from a table over and they smelled delicious. Will definitely be a regular now!

Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: Went here for a smoothie which ended up being made with a plethora of syrups, powder, a ton of ice and very little actual fruit. It tasted ok and the staff was friendly but there are much better smoothie options nearby in my opinion. Not interested in boba so I won't return.

Reviews.Author: Tif
Reviews.Content: We LOVE this place! The employees / owners have got to be some of the friendliest we've encountered in any cafe or Japanese restaurant so far! I love Boba, but they have a much wider variety of drinks and food than just that. Our favorite is the Honey Dew Smoothie. They are VERY child friendly. The dining area is clean; offering a modern minimalist atmosphere. The location makes it difficult to find so I'm not sure how much drive-by customers they get. I love their concept and hope they stick they thrive in the Northwest! If you are not familiar with Boba but like smoothie places check out Tea Time! It's not one of those places where they make you feel awkward if you are not Asian (like some of the Chinatown shops).

Reviews.Author: Kathlin
Reviews.Content: Excellent tea, superb service, nice ambiance! Very large selections of delicious beverages.

Reviews.Author: Amber
Reviews.Content: I love the drinks. The boba is usually made right, and the staff is friendly. The owners are usually working, and they've always been super pleasant. My only complaint is the wait sometimes. It can take upwards of 15 minutes to get my drink from the time I order, and I have occasionally had it take longer. But apparently I think it's worth the wait because I keep coming back. :)

Reviews.Author: Jenny
Reviews.Content: I will always miss my hometown Boba place, but this place does have things that my boba place doesn't. I am a personal fan of the Yakisoba fries. The order that I received was big enough to feed my friend and I. Their Wintermelon milk tea was also very good, not too sweet and just the right amount of boba. Great place to have a conversation or study. Great natural light from the windows in the front. Also has a couch or two for group to congregate around. Super interested to try more of their snacks. Will return to try more of their drink choices.   The only off thing is that their drink selection is quite small, I wish they carried more variety in t he milk tea flavors. But they do carry smoothies, frapps, and basic tea that you can add boba too.

Reviews.Author: Mallory
Reviews.Content: IM ABSOLUTELY IN LOVE WITH THIS Cafe!!!I was introduced to boba tea when I was pregnant with my son and have been in love with the funny little tapioca balls ever since . I've tested various places in China town and at Hawaiian restaurants but none of them compare to this wonderfull store.the boba itself is made fresh hourly which makes all the difference, and all there drinks are amazing. My particular favorite is the mango coconut , very refeshing especially in the Vegas heat. Before I just craved boba now I crave this store.you can tell by the moment you walk in how much the owners are proud of there cafe as they should be with their amazing staff and fantastic menu ! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Author: Nkwachukwu
Reviews.Content: I've been to kung fu tea, tea station, and a few restaurants that serve boba. This place matches them in quality and beats them in convenience. The inside of the cafe has enough room for you and yours to hang out while you drink, and you could probably get some work done in there if you cared to, as long as you don't need a solid wifi connection the whole time. Wifi is free but it's pretty spotty. However, I can understand if the place doesn't want ppl camping out there for free WiFi so it's more of an observation than a criticism. If you have the hankering for boba and this place is closer than spring mountain for you, check it out. Random: they don't seem to specifically have a green tea. Think the closest you can get us jasmine. Try Hokkaido, it's tasty and the name makes it sound hearty (at least when I say it). The watermelon smoothie is also as good as it sounds. Tastes like a sweet, cold watermelon not like watermelon candies that are usually some combination of super sweet, tangy, and sour. I'm not a watermelon candy hater, but, come on, *whispers* you know how those candies are.

Reviews.Author: Keith
Reviews.Content: for north Las Vegas this boba cafe is pretty legit.  they have flavors I haven't seen in Chinatown plus the staff is amazingly friendly.  it's more of a local spot, which I like for the fact they get to know their customers.  always coming up with new and exciting flavors, just incase you wanna try something new.    they serve quality food and of course their boba is on point.  my reg is the white chocolate or the coconut milk green tea.  their brick toast is pretty good as well.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: The best! Everyone was right about the customer service too! I ordered mochi and the guy at the counter was really helpful with educating me on the different products.

Reviews.Author: Wendy
Reviews.Content: As far as Boba in Vegas goes this place is the best (and I've tried multiple). Other places are either too sugary or their bobas taste like they've been sitting in the pot for days. Tea Time Cafe has said that they cook bobas once every two hours (that means fresh bobas people!)  I get the Taro smoothie with boba and pudding. I've also tried their honey ice milk tea which was delicious. Sometimes they have taro pudding too which is quite delicious. Their food is okay but really you should go there for the drinks.

Reviews.Author: Trish
Reviews.Content: their customer service sets them apart... the awesome drinks and good food puts them over the top!

Reviews.Author: Meg
Reviews.Content: Honestly, this place ranks very high up on my list of favorite places. In fact, I signed up for Yelp just to write a review!  Like the previous reviewers stated, the drinks are delicious. The two men that I've seen behind the counter are incredibly knowledgeable, friendly, and accommodating and always make for a pleasant experience.  Today, I decided to have lunch at Tea Time. The pork cutlet bento sounded delicious, and at $6.95 the price was most definitely right. I was truly surprised by both the quantity and the quality of the food. Rice, a large cutlet, macaroni salad, two gyoza, soup, a fruit cup, and a couple sides of sauce were included. I'm not really a big eater, but there was plenty for lunch as well as enough to save for a snack later.  I hope that more people decide to try Tea Time. I assure you that they won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: excellent boba tea and friendly staff. taking off a star for the wanna be hipsters/posers out front trying to judge people as they walk in/out. they did not even have any food or drink. management should take care of this.

Reviews.Author: Yu
Reviews.Content: Boba on the north side!! Nce Bonaparte and you can tell them to make your boba the way you want it. Nice place and cool people!! Definitely the boba to go place if you live on the northwest side of vegas!!!

Reviews.Author: Shea
Reviews.Content: I have been craving an almond milk tea & I've always loved tea time. The wait was not long at all. My tea tastes pretty good, however, I've had better. Overall, good place for a sweet treat.

Reviews.Author: Flo
Reviews.Content: Tried it for the first time today! No crowd on a weekday afternoon. Friendly staff and lots of flavors. I noticed a bunch of items were covered on the food menu but I came for drinks anyway.  I ordered a Passion Fruit Black Tea w/ Lychee Jelly & the boyfriend got a Kiwi Smoothie w/ Boba. Both were delicious. Not too much ice on mine, which I appreciated so it won't be watered down until my last sip. The Kiwi Smoothie was fresh & fruity.  We also ordered the Sweet Milk Butter Brick Toast. Wish the toast was bigger, but I guess nothing can compare to Ichiza. Haha. It's just a toast with condensed milk. It hit the spot though.  All in all, if you're in the North side, then it's your go-to boba place. If not, then you can opt for better places on Spring Mountain side.

Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: A great place to get Boba! It's tucked away so you aren't dealing with too much traffic, but it's still close to the freeway and major streets. The prices are standard for boba tea (but still inexpensive).

Reviews.Author: Krystle
Reviews.Content: Spent Christmas in Vegas this year and per ritual, my sister and I always overdose on boba. Unfortunately in the past, it would involve us having to travel to boba places that aren't exactly a hop, skip and a jump from my parent's house.  Thankfully...TEA TIME CAFE entered our lives. It's about 5 minutes from the house so we gave it a go. First off, service is AMAZING! Asia took my order over the phone and she was great! As someone who attempts to place phone orders at boba places all over the  Asia  of Southern California, it was so refreshing placing an order with someone who was super friendly, coherent, spoke and understood English and was patient.   Ordered Thai tea with boba 25% sugar, taro milk tea, 3 jasmine green teas with aloe with varying levels of sweetness. My family has varying tastes of sweetness and it was great that Tea Time can make drinks from 0% sweetness (sugar, honey or splenda) following in increments of 25%.   Onto the food... Really REALLY sad that they no longer carry popcorn chicken or curry fries. To me, popcorn chicken is a staple at boba places so was sad when I was told they no longer carry it. Oh well. I did order takoyaki and garlic seaweed parmesan fries. Both were delicious! When my sister and I went to pick up the order, we couldn't resist also purchasing 2 pistachio macarons and damn were they delicious.   Overall, fantastic service and amazing drinks & food. But... BRING BACK THE POPCORN CHICKEN! :P

Reviews.Author: Derrick
Reviews.Content: I had the taro root milk tea with boba and it was delicious. The workers were very friendly and they gave us some samples to try. As good as the place I normally go to in Mesa AZ.

Reviews.Author: eren
Reviews.Content: I love this place! Friendly staff and yummy eats and drinks. Tuna rice balls are great, yakisoba fries very addictive, and the tea---OH THE TEA! You can be creative here and they go with it. Mix what you want! Fun stuff! So far my favorite is the coconut almond milk smoothie. YESSS!

Reviews.Author: Marge
Reviews.Content: My daughter wanted Boba after a day at the park and found this place on yelp. Inside is nice, lots of tables and chairs. The guy who took our order was patient as we looked over their menu. Besides drinks they also offer food items which is nice. I got their peach black tea which was yummy and my family enjoyed the strawberry and honeydew boba drinks.

Reviews.Author: Elita1
Reviews.Content: Nope. Every single time I come here they're out of what I want so then I ask for something else. Also, out. Why haven't they fixed their inventory issue yet?????

Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: It's so great that there is something like this on this side of town. Superb customer service. I could ask them anything, but they don't smother me. The variety of tea is delightfully surprising. There is so much more than what appears on the paper menu. My favorite is the avocado smoothie with boba. They have free delivery (if you're close). They also have a discount for local businesses. The food here is great. I cannot get over the tuna rice balls (topped with eel sauce). There's plenty of seating and the interior is very appropriate, also very handicap accessible. Call ahead though because the food takes some time, that is, if you're in a rush. Best of all is the price. I even think this place is worth the drive if you aren't on this side of town.

Reviews.Author: Nelson
Reviews.Content: YELP 365 CHALLENGE 2014-(159/365)  Boba In My Hood   We live so close to Tea Time Cafe, in fact, I think its the only spot in our neighborhood. On the times I have been here, it was just to get a boba drink on the way home. I have tried their Lychee, Taro, and Avocado(all powder) boba smoothies which were good and hit the spot  especially on hot days and days where we don't really feel like venturing too far out..  The service was great and the boba had a good texture. I haven't tried any of their savory bites yet, but looking at all the photos, looks like I'll be returning to give those a try. Conveniently located for those of us who live in the area, a perfect spot to beat this summer heat! ALOHA!!!  Shaka Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  4

Reviews.Author: FoodiesRwe
Reviews.Content: Finally got to check this place out! Ordered the taro smoothie with boba and a couple of there macaroons,everything was delicious..nice fast and friendly service. Will definitely come back if I'm in the area!

Reviews.Author: Shana
Reviews.Content: Awesome menu. Absolutely delicious drinks & desserts. I love this place! The atmosphere is open & friendly. I have never had a bad experience here. Go there. Just go there!

Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Sigh. Henderson still doesn't have good boba, but Centennial does? I'm happy for you guys, I guess...  Highly rated boba always intrigues me, but I wasn't able to justify the super long drive from home until I was already in the area to visit a friend. On my way home, Tea Time Cafe was a convenient stop just off the highway, so I was eager to visit.  I stuck to one of my go-to orders, a large jasmine milk tea ($4.25, 24 oz) with boba (usually +$0.35, but Yelp check-in = one free topping). It didn't take too long for them to prepare the drink, and I was happy to see a bubbly froth on the surface indicating that they'd shaken it to create the namesake bubbles of the bubble tea.  The jasmine flavor wasn't extremely strong, but it was noticeable in every sip. The boba tasted fine considering that it's not honey boba. I overheard that it was freshly made, and it was actually was a little too al dente at the time. But it's always better to err on the side of chewy tapioca pearls than mushy.  I didn't make any adjustments, but on a warm day like today, it was better to err on the side of ice. As for sweetness, it was pretty balanced considering that I took on the default full sugar level instead of going for 75% or 50%  Instead of a stamp card, they use FiveStars. It's a unified system that I often see in California, and you can check in for a reward via phone number, keychain card, wallet-sized card, or even app. Ten drinks = one free large drink, and I'd be very content with that if I lived or worked anywhere remotely nearby.  As it is, I just don't see myself coming back very often, but I will keep Tea TIme Cafe in my memory banks just in case I'm in the area. It's an above average shop (at least in the Vegas scene) with tea and coffee (and some sweet and savory foods) that locals should be glad to have.

Reviews.Author: Shane
Reviews.Content: Best boba in the Northwest. Hands down. I would recommend stopping in if you are in the area.

Reviews.Author: Laurie
Reviews.Content: Any boba place with my favorite winter melon tea is gonna get a good rating from me. Unfortunately they don't make it in-house and use the syrup so it's not as healthy but it is just as yummy! Plenty of seating and smiles. All I ask is for smiles.

Reviews.Author: Adrienne
Reviews.Content: Been going to this boba shop for a few years.  Not the best boba in town but will definitely hit the spot if going to Spring Mountain is out of the question.  They go back and forth with serving food which I've tried once or twice which was pretty good!  Favorite drinks are the matcha frappe and the taro.  Their rewards system is pretty fair too.  Would recommend!

Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: Hot Day in Vegas + Boba = Great Day.  I wish I had one of these near home...  I seriously had one of the best bobas of my life here.  The peppermint milk boba is a must try.  It's smooth and creamy with a hint of mint that is so refreshing.  The boba substance was pretty top notch, too.  It's chewy, but not overly chewy where your jaw wants to fall off.  I've also had there green milk teas, but this peppermint milk one was dang good.  Also, the staff here are wonderfully nice.  The lines get long in here so with all the hustle and bustle, they still manage to have a smile on their faces.  You'll most likely find me here when I'm in Vegas. :)

Reviews.Author: Neat
Reviews.Content: Awesome tea cafe.... very nice staff and the atmosphere is relaxing. I like it... great place.  Boba tea is awesome....

Reviews.Author: Joan
Reviews.Content: It was my first time trying out Tea Time and I had a great experience. The staff was friendly and my smoothie tasted great. The guy making it gave me a sample cup to try first to make sure I liked it. He said he didn't want me walking out with a drink that I didn't like. How thoughtful! I loved it.

Reviews.Author: Kathy
Reviews.Content: This place is special to me because it is where I popped my boba cherry. Never heard of boba before but found the yelp reviews and had to discover what this boba was all about!  Boba are weird slimy candy balls that defy all that is staid and sensible in the world of adulthood. I'll never forget the first bobas sliding up the fat straw onto my tongue...it was both shocking and giggle-inducing.  I LOVE Boba!   The service is excellent. You can try a drink and if you don't like it, you can have a replacement. One drawback is that it's difficult to choose a drink from the extensive menu. Another is that they are often out of teas, but that's ok because there is no shortage of choices.   The food is very good oriental cafe food at a very reasonable price. It's kinda like 7-eleven food in Japan (that sounds bad, but if you've ever been to Japan, you'll know that their 7-11 snack foods are very good...miles better than ours!).    The location is a little bit odd, but Tea Time Cafe is a little gem of an eatery. I'm a fan.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan
Reviews.Content: If you go to Tea Time and don't get their Tuna Rice Balls, you're making a big mistake!  I ordered mine with mayo and teriyaki sauce and couldn't stop eating them! They have so many different options for tea and drinks, it was hard to choose, but I ended up with a Boba Milk Green Tea and didn't regret it. It wasn't too sweet but just sweet enough. My wife had the Boba Mocha Smoothie which was very tasty as well. You have to at least stop by and try it out! It's DEFINITELY my new spot.

Reviews.Author: Martselina
Reviews.Content: Updated 3/8/2016 (yes, still frequent this place)- I can proudly say we're regulars here. Can't beat the variety and most of all the flavors of teas they have. Remarkable quality, I know because I am a tea drinker and generally really picky about my teas, hot or iced. My favorites are jasmine green, rose green, and lavender teas, however I have yet to try one I don't like. They also have almond and soy milk options if you've got restrictions or just prefer something lighter. The owners and staff are very friendly. I always feel welcome when I walk in. They learned my name long before I did theirs. My order has never been messed up, and they always have great recommendations when I can't make up my mind.  The place is always clean and smells lovely. Decor has a modern twist on it. They have made many improvements too, both to the decor and the menu.  Oh, did I mention they sell the best macaroons I have ever had!? Seriously, try one! It's only a dollar and some change.  My review may be biased because I've been a huge fan of this place for several years now!

Reviews.Author: Jean
Reviews.Content: Great staff and better boba! I come here a few times a week, trying different flavors. Some better than others but the friendly staff is always the same. Happy there's a boba shop nearby

Reviews.Author: Koji
Reviews.Content: Boba was okay, little over done. Better to call ahead and order, can get busy since some of the younger crowd can hang there...

Reviews.Author: Manami
Reviews.Content: Even before I stepped my foot inside this cafe, I knew with their faded ass sign that I shouldn't walk in with a high expectation. And I was right.   I walked in and was greeted by an unpleasant smell and unenthusiastic staffs working in a dim and not-so welcoming atmosphere. They are not friendly unless you are a regular there or friends with the workers. Seems like they don't give two shits about the business which is concerning.   Over the two visits, I've got to try their milk green tea and oolong milk tea. I must say they do brew some good aromatic teas and drinks are not overly sweet which I appreciate.   Milk green tea was good but lighter taste than their oolong milk tea. Or should I say  oolong  milk tea because I'm positive they had messed up my oolong for a black tea. I don't mind the mess up because we are human being and make mistakes. On top of that, drink was not the worst I had. I'm personally not a fan of black tea in general but I will say they have a good black tea here.   Boba was a plain disappointment. It was a mush, or glob of gooey mess rather than a chewy texture I'm used to. I did redeem my Yelp check-in offer for a free topping but soon after trying their boba, I regretted getting it. Ugh..  Lots of improvement to be made. Definitely a boba shop for locals so not many harsh critics for a mediocre place like this one, hence their 4.5 star rating on Yelp.

Reviews.Author: Christy
Reviews.Content: Great place for all of us boba fiends. Reasonable prices and a great atmosphere.  Their boba is always fresh and they have lots of different flavors like coconut, taro, and mango.

Reviews.Author: Ashkia
Reviews.Content: I'm a regular here and they're always out of something or inconsistent.  They took my mom's money today and made her drink before letting her know they don't have anything to make the rose green tea that I get every time.  Please get your shit together tea time.  Ok Update:       It's been 8 days and I decided to go back bc I wanted a drink. And sis. Guess what they didn't have?? You got it?! That's right! They didn't have shit to make the Rose Green tea. That's my drink you guys, like that's the one for me.  I've been a regular here for about 4 years or so and if they keep this up my family and I won't be coming here anymore. I'll drive farther if it means getting a consistent product.   UPDATE #2: Y'ALL I CALLED TODAY AND THEY STILL AINT GOT SHIT. What kind of business is this? Who's mans is this? I pretty sure the owner is named ken and wow it doesn't seem like he values his business or regular customers.  I've been updating this review for 2 weeks. There is literally no excuse for this.   UPDATE #3:  Hey y'all what's good happy 2017,  So today the owner deadass complained about me to my mom lmao, that's so funny. If you're reading this Ken, please know that it was me who made this comment and also know that my  nasty  comments were funny as hell and also not nasty at all. I'm sorry if you felt offended by them but honestly as a loyal customer it was frustrating to hear for over two months that you didn't have product. Also I'm an adult and I don't need you to stop mom and call me out. What did you think she was going to do, reprimand me? If you don't appreciate my comments then please know that I do not appreciate that.  I still come here and I've always been a fan because it's close and the drinks aren't overly sweet. I like your business but that was very unprofessional and this is a public forum where I can post my experiences.  Here's your 4 stars.

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: I've been here about 5 times already and every time the boba was really delicious. I'm totally pushing the Taro smoothie right now, it is DELISH!!!!@#$%#%^!!!!!  Now, excitements aside...  The actual bobas themselves are extremely chewy and very sweet. It's not soggy and I never had to worry about the bobas being hard or what not.  Now since this place is no where near the strip area where there are many boba places, I was apprehensive of going since I didn't want to go to a place where they would just open up an eatery that is a rarity in the area and make stuff that are subpar since..well, they're the only ones in the area. FEAR NOT! These guys seriously can whip up some good smoothies and milk teas. I'm sure i did some run-ons in there but I'm enjoying my taro smoothie with boba right now so that can be forgiven right?  I went in today around 4:30PM and was sad there wasn't anyone in there. The service was (and is always) great, the person usually at the counter (I believe is also the owner of the store) is really nice and will give you unbias reviews of the taste of drinks. I'm talking brutally honest. Really good guy.  But the bobas alone are drool worthy. GOGOGO!

Reviews.Author: Katelyn
Reviews.Content: This place is a really great boba place! My favorite drink is the honey milk tea! It's so sweet but doesn't taste artificial. The boba is also a great texture! It's a hidden gem if you're looking for great boba!

Reviews.Author: Connie
Reviews.Content: I really hate that these guys are so far from me.  And I recommend you guys wipe down the customers drinks before you serve it to them that would be great!   But!!!   I love your drinks!!! Especially because you guys have egg pudding as a topping for your drinks!! Reminds me of Cali!!

Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I've been here twice so far, and I will be back. Typically, my go to smoothie joint is Tropical Smoothie CafÃ©. But, I was cruising Yelp when I discovered this place and was compelled to give it a shot. My first experience was meh, I DO like boba, but with my Mango smoothie, I was overwhelmed with the amount of boba given to me. Nonetheless, I enjoyed the quality of it. Second time around, I had a taro smoothie with boba but asked for the boba to be held back a bit, and an order of spam musubi. The musubi AND the smoothie was GRAND. So much quality put into these smoothies. Give it a shot if you like tea or smoothies or boba, they will not disappoint.

Reviews.Author: Gina
Reviews.Content: I am obsessed with this place. The best macaroons and Boba I've had in town so far with a huge variety of unique flavors of both. Come early because the macaroons sell out quickly. They also have an awesome loyalty/rewards program.

Reviews.Author: Macy
Reviews.Content: I've been to other tea boba place and this is not the best.  However, living in North las vegas, I appreciate the fact that there is a boba tea house nearby to satisfy my cravings.   I ordered the Jelly drink, it's just mediocre.  As I suck all the drink, the bits of the crunchy fruity goodies were left at the bottom of the cup.  I have to find a spoon to scoop them out.  I don't like the hassle. I love the shaved ice bowl that you can put as many toppings as you want, but they don't have it.  I haven't tried the food, but they don't look too inviting. I'll still come by once in a while, but for good tea boba drink, I have to stop by China town on spring mountain.

Reviews.Author: Tetsuro
Reviews.Content: I've had 14 reviews deleted by the legal department this year. And, I really wanna write a nice review for Tea Time Cafe that will still be around this time next year. So, I've decided to drop my tired and worn out  Schtick  in order to avoid violating any more TOS. Therefore, I have devised an ingenious idea to use everyone else's schticks, since they don't seem to have as many reviews deleted.   So here it goes:   THE SKINNY Tea Time Cafe is a real jewel of the Northwest. THE SKINNY, they have honey toast with green tea ice cream. THE SKINNY I loved it more than I love Canada.  THE SKINNY, with honey toast in the NW, I don't have to drive to Ichiza or Shuseki anymore! THE SKINNY, the guy who manages this place was really nice to me and didn't mind that I waited on the couch for 10 minutes for my friends to show up. THE SKINNY, they got a cool claw machine that has rilakkuma and domos.  THE SKINNY I don't LIKE Tea Time Cafe. I LOVE it. THE SKINNY If I don't love it, I don't swallow.   I LOVE BIG WEINERS! But they didn't have weiners here, MORONS! So perhaps my morals helped me get the curry fries. They are perhaps like chili cheese fries but with curry instead of chili. The fries weren't immoral and perhaps were cooked extra crispy. It did not hella suck. Perhaps, it was the opposite of sucking. Speaking about sucking, I sucked them down like a hoover! The workers were not IDIOTS or CREEPY immorals! They were actually really nice, SCORE! Perhaps, I love the fries more than I love big weiners. And the prices be so low dat I be ballin on a budget! YAY!  GABAZINGA! I'm so fun! I showed up to Tea Time Cafe alone, but I always have fun when I'm around! While waiting for my friend to show up, I broke out my photography skills and took several pictures of the food I ordered. But, I accidentally deleted all the photos before uploading them onto yelp. Jeez could I be more ridiculous? I sometimes wish I could be! Wizzle Wozzle! The curry fries were perfectly browned and the curry itself was made from a real gram masala rather than a powder mix. It wasn't JCZ, but I was satisfied and not too uncomfortably full. I wasn't trippin... and after taking a selfie with that same goofball face I always make, Amanda and I ended up break dancing on out of there.   (T)hank u BIG MAHALO Amanda-monstah for always recommending such great restaurants! SHAKA!   (E)very Japanese item from ramen to unagi don is on the menu-monstah. ATTACK!!! (A)pple Yogurt Smoothie had me slurping like a smoothie-killah!! ATTACK!!   (T)una rice balls with unagi sauce is on FIYAH! Bomb! (I)'m running out of creative words to use for this schtick (M)e has a gud tee drunk... (E)pithelial-myoepithelial carcinoma..Sorry I couldn't think of another word that started with E.  Wakki Lakki Aloha! (yelp challenge 100 out of 2343)  after dropping off donations at the next yelp help event and bragging about it all over talk, i'm gonna make sure that tea time cafe becomes my regular spot to hang out with my friends who are so much more popular than you. i can see myself jumping into my vessel of transportation which carries the shape of my soul to tea time cafe every morning for coffee and a boba.  i don't go to bad restaurants, and i can see a bad restaurant from miles away because i have super powers..i can see through bullshit. and tea time cafe is ranked #1 by centennial hills yelp. i'm not spreading rumors again, ttc is more legit than yonaka. i can't believe i just said that, well i guess i'm at that age where my brain just says things just to see what happens.   99.9% of the time it's those darn BANDWAGON faux Japanese WANNABES who run 99.9% of these places. My ability to sense bandwagon wannabe Japanese restaurants is 99.9% more acute than the reflexes of the kitty cat on my profile picture. I'm 99.9% sure Tea Time Cafe is 99.9% not a bandwagon wannabe.  I love Tea Time Cafe more than 99.9% of yelpers. I've eaten here 99.9% more than all of you. They got good miso ramen here, and as you know I got 99.9% more ramen experience than you. They also have Tonkatsu here, not Tonkotsu!! GET IT RIGHT!!! GOD DAMN IT! Why is it that 99.9% of you non-Japanese get tonkAtsu confused with tonkOtsu! That makes me feel 99.9% like blowing my brains out at Kabuto where I'm 99.9% sure they are not bandwagon wannabes.   BTW Amanda, keep your meaningless crown!   Legal disclaimer- RELAX!!! Please learn how to take a joke. I'm a big fan of all your reviews and schticks. This was not a diss, it was an informative parody.  At least this review was more informative than those yelp tips that only say  yummy  or  the duke is here!

Reviews.Author: Gabrielle
Reviews.Content: I never even thought to post a review on yelp before, but I've been here approximately 1.2 bazillion times. More or less. I've gotten about 6 or 7 free drinks with the stamp card over the past few years... So that's about 60-70 drinks purchased? Dang. That's a lot of money- I guess I should cut down. Lol yeah right.  Tea Time has always been super adorable- a great place to hang with friends, study, go on a date, or people watch. Actually it's a small place and people will notice you being creepy- so don't do that. They have couches, games, a crane machine, a bookshelf, a community bulletin board (love!), bright decor, friendly staff, always clean surfaces, and better boba than I've found in Chinatown so far. Of course that could be due to no longer looking for anything better, as this place is close to me and my favorite place ever.  If you're new to trying boba, get the honeydew, taro, or Thai milk tea with boba. They have a bunch of other awesome flavors to try the second or tenth time you come here, but you haven't tried boba tea until you've tried those three flavors. I recommend ALL the drinks on the menu. I only had one drink I didn't like a long time ago, and it turned out the guy who made it was new and turned off quite a few customers with his creations. He's either gone or not making drinks anymore though, so not to worry!   Food? Better stick with the veggie spring rolls. I know quite a few people who like the food there, but I'm not one of them. The spring rolls are pretty yummy though.  Recently they started selling little macarons... And for $1.65 each you wouldn't think I would buy one. But I did. And then I bought three more. And I would have paid $2 each. SO good. Don't shove the whole dang thing in your mouth, just take little bites and let it melt in your mouth, and you've got more than your money's worth.  I'm not sure what else to say about this place- so get in there and see for yourself! Unless some unlikely and unfortunate service circumstance occurs or you are a grumpy cat who doesn't like dancing taste buds, sunshine, or smiling, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Jade
Reviews.Content: Came in for a drink after breakfast.   The guy at the counter pointed out theres a few signs with new items other than their main menu. Got a Lavender Milk Tea and wanted only a little bit of boba..I don't ever finish them. Since we only wanted so little he said we won't charge us for it. Nice.   He made our drink and also told us they have wifi in case we need a place to access internet and relax. He handed us our drink and told us to enjoy and gave us a stamp card....very nice and polite guy.   Definitely this was a needed business here....there's no Boba shop anywhere close. I liked my drink a lot and it was a generous size. I will be back to also try the snacks and get more refreshments. Like Cindy, hope this business does well....boba is my favorite summer treat!

Reviews.Author: Brandon
Reviews.Content: Hot peppermint green tea for breakfast lunch and dinner, maybe a green apple slushy for dessert :)

Reviews.Author: April
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE this place!! Never too sweet or dull & the boba has a perfect texture! Inexpensive for great quality:) I usually always get the strawberry banana w extra boba n it's always perfect!! Must go

Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: It's hot now so lots of cold drinks are in my future. Yesterday we were driving by and thirsty so we stopped. I got the thai milk tea with boba. It was so refreshing and the boba was good too. I have found my new boba spot. My girlfriend had a honey milk tea I think. I only had a sip but it tasted good. We decided on their yakisoba fries to accompany the drinks. They are a must try at least once. It has herbs and I think a mayo with a brown sauce and was super tasty. The staff were super friendly. The only downside is I can imagine it getting packed now that the heat has arrived. I will be back.

Reviews.Author: stacey
Reviews.Content: Great boba, service is prompt but it can get crowded at times. The macaroons are awesome! They also have a pretty big menu of food :)

Reviews.Author: Ebony
Reviews.Content: Neat little place, they have a variety of teas (herbal, fruity), smoothies, and coffees for your liking. My very first time having any kind of boba tea (I had the boba milk tea - and it taste like milk and tea...go figure!!!) and a great first time at that. Cool spot to come in relax and sip some drank/tea.

Reviews.Author: Crystal
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Vegas and came here all the time. It's been a year and a half, and I'm back in town and I LOVE what they've done with the renovations!!  Anyways, we ordered an iced Thai milk tea, lavender milk tea, strawberry slush, strawberry yogurt smoothie and an americano.... All came out excellent!!  Also ordered gyoza.... My 8 yr old INHALED it, and she's very picky. So needless to say, it was good LOL. We also ordered their Parmesan seaweed garlic fries, and it was GOOD! Interesting, yet very delicious combination.   I highly recommend this place

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I love a nice little coffee/tea cafe with Asian flavor! Try a tasty boba tea with a tasty nutella toast! Can't go wrong and the service is great!

Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: We wanted to go to an cafe with WiFi to work on my fav Asian's resume, so I Yelp nearby spots that meets the criteria of free WiFi and also serves food.  Two birds with one stone, was the goal.  The results in the NW area was slim, but this Tea Time CafÃ© was one of the top options returned. And after a quick call to confirm the availability of food and something to drink at the same location, off we went.  The driving direction was a little off, and it was a good thing that I went with my instinct rather than blindly and obediently following the direction offered up by my GPS (I would have u-turned and completely pass the place and had to double back again).  It is in this business park/strip mall type of complex.  The place was nearly emptied when we arrived, and there were 2 Caucasian ladies working behind the counter.  I immediately thought that that was a little, you know, different!  All the boba shops I have ever been to in my entire life had at least an Asian working there.  Their menu is reasonably diverse, and offers a good selection of drinks that you would find at your typical boba tea shops in the Chinatown area. Plus they serve food items like simple sushi rolls, spam musubi, and fried potstickers.  As far as drink orders, we only ordered off of their Smoothie menu, and I thought it was good. The boba was chewy, but does not have too much bite to it.  The decor is simple.  Have a comfy couch with a table and the regular tables and chairs.  While we were there, the bulk of the customers were actually non-Asians and mostly kids (H.S. age).  It is a much different scene than I am used to, but this is cool.  If I am in the area and needs a place with free WiFi, I would be back.

Reviews.Author: Natalia
Reviews.Content: Was expecting so much more especially because I hear so much hype about it! I got the Japanese matcha coffee and I had to add coffee mate! It was a little weird. Not my thing! But, on the bright side, the staff were friendly :)

Reviews.Author: L.M.
Reviews.Content: Bobas are the best but the wait is horrible! I've waited 30-40 min for 2 drinks, not cool! They are always out of flavors....

Reviews.Author: Nicholas
Reviews.Content: I would have given this place an easy 5 stars 6 months ago. It pains me to give such a low score but you give credit where it's deserved and when it's not...well, that's what Yelp is for.   This last visit was depressing as they didn't have 3 of the 4 things I wanted to order!  I walked in knowing they wouldn't have my macaroons buy they also removed: honey brick toast with ice cream, sushi (except spam musubi), a couple tea options, board games and basic music (at least put on some elevator music, geez).  This place used to be a comfortable spot for people to hang out and now it's turned into an awkward, boring coffee/tea shop (and the coffee/tea quality went down as well). Looks like I'll have to either go back to Tea Station or find another tea shop nearby.

Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic gem in the most unlikely of places! Tea Time is run by Ken and Ritchie, two super friendly brothers who always have welcoming smiles. Surprisingly, they provide an extravagant array of selections from milk teas to slushes to smoothies. Their boba is well-cooked and chewy, and they actually offer egg pudding and aloe vera as inclusions!! They will soon have sago, something that I've been waiting for forever in Vegas! They make a FANTASTIC taro smoothie, which I find myself now addicted to. Their lychee is yummy and not overly-sweet, and Ken even went out of his way to make me a thai iced tea smoothie, which turned out deliciously.   If drinks aren't your thing, Tea Time also offers a great snacking menu from mochi ice cream to dim sum dumplings to their new shaker fries (the curry flavor is my fav).   The decor is open and refreshingly clean, a welcome environment in this desert heat. What I appreciate most is the fact that it doesn't smell like  fried,  unlike some other boba tea houses in Vegas that don't have adequate ventilation for their frying stations. You won't leave Tea Time smelling like frying oil.   They're off to a great start, and I'm excited to see what they have in store for the future.

Reviews.Author: Adriana
Reviews.Content: I have been a Time Time fan for years now and I am finally giving this place a review, though it does not need it. Everyone knows how great this place is. It is conveniently located off the 95 and ann road. The boba is so delicious. They have all the flavored drinks you could think of, and they are willing to accommodate any request. The staff is always extremely friendly. Nothing like a smile and a boba. They have comfy tables and couches, boardgames and books, but also wi-fi. My favorite boba place by far.

Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: Went on 9-13-15 around 12:30 hoping to get some grub.  I'd been craving ramen all week and I saw the pictures on yelp of their ramen and fried chicken.   Alas, they no longer have the ramen or the fried chicken.  And they were out of macarons on the day I went.  Boo!    So we went and ate at the cracked egg and then came back over here for a slush.  I got a small pineapple slush with boba for $3.78.   I checked in on Yelp and there was an offer for 1 free topping and I had no problem redeeming it.

Reviews.Author: Liz
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite boba place and also it's just 5 minutes away from my house. It is very chill and quiet and not as crowded as one in Chinatown. The owners and the people here are very nice and friendly.

Reviews.Author: Kimi
Reviews.Content: I love Tea Time Cafe! My personal favorites are Coconut Milk Tea and Thai Tea with boba. Location is great because where I live, it takes about twenty minutes for me to get boba from china town which suuuuuucks. The staff that work there are super nice and since I go here on a daily basis, they already know what drink I want :)

Reviews.Author: Tommi
Reviews.Content: Discovered this place last night, and I'm already contemplating going back this afternoon! Decided to try the cookies & cream smoothie, as well as my standard fave- honeydew. Both were absolutely delightful! They use real cookies in the cookies & cream, just FYI! :) Also treated myself to a vanilla bean macaroon....another great choice. I was really happy with my experience, and am already looking forward to going back!

Reviews.Author: Christopher
Reviews.Content: The drinks are amaza-balls. Absolutely delicious. Prices are pretty good too. The chicken though, its damn terrible. It tastes like deep fried plastic bag.  I may give their food another chance in the future, but not for a while

Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: I am only giving one star as the place is decently appointed.  To be honest I am not a bubble tea fan, it is mostly fake and artificial. That said I tried an iced jasmine tea. First gulp was OK but several sips into it, it was really not good at all. That's what happens when you strip away all the extra sugar, you get down to pure fake powered grossness. I only had 1/5 of it and asked for something real, like a coffee... The girl came over and told me she'd have to charge me to fix the drink. Really? I guess I'm use to  customer service  I told her that she is welcome to charge me and that if she did I had the opportunity to write this review about how cheap, fake, crappy and totally lame their customer service is. I have no idea why this place has the stars it does the product is fake crap, and the customer service which is even worse!

Reviews.Author: Emilee
Reviews.Content: I'm giving this place 3 stars just because it's the only boba tea spot in the area.  I went in to get macarons  and Thai tea with boba. They only has 3 macarons which was understandable since they get it from an outside company.  But they ran out of boba. That was pretty upsetting. The guys behind me also left without anything for the same reason. However, customer service was pretty good.  Hopefully next time I go they have boba.

Reviews.Author: Rainier
Reviews.Content: tldr  Pretty good tasting drinks. Have the choice to pick your drinks sweetness. The boba tapioca is great too.  Get: -brown sugar milk tea with boba  Protip: don't choose any sweetness under 50%; drink will taste too bland.

Reviews.Author: Shawn
Reviews.Content: Nearby boba spot for us NW people!  I tried a 24oz Mango Passion Fruit Smoothie for a bit over $5.   Good smoothies here, just a bit on the sweet end...probably just sugar added I'm guessing.  Seems like a cool place to hang out for a bit and get a good drink.  It's comfortable here :)

Reviews.Author: Nadine
Reviews.Content: I love this place! Always so friendly and of course the drinks are always delicious!! Will be back soon!

Reviews.Author: Cloud
Reviews.Content: I absolutely adore this place! I have been coming here for years now and love their teas and macaroons. It's a cool place to hang out and everyone is super sweet and helpful in suggesting new things to try, but a blond girl who works there has a a bit of a tough attitude.
