She honestly makes the experience a bit worse as she doesn't fill cups all the way up with your drink and gives a bad vibe every time I walk in there. It may only be me, but I find everyone else has a great attitude and is very welcoming. I love Tea Time and will always give my business, but I believe customer service is always first (as I own my own business)!

Reviews.Author: Chrisene-Faye
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed that they ran out of macarons.  The lady in the counter said the best time to get macarons was in the morning because they ALWAYS run out in the afternoon.  How about they order enough macarons everyday so they DON'T run out by the afternoon?    I like the location of this place.  I think this is the only boba place located in the northwest side of town and not in Chinatown.  Nice, open, clean place with plenty of seating.  They also have board games.  I played some Jenga while I was there.    I had their rose milk tea and the chocolate banana with peanut butter smoothie.  They were okay.  I probably should've asked for less sugar. I also had their yakosiba fries, which is an acquired taste.

Reviews.Author: Crystal
Reviews.Content: There are already a bunch of positive reviews, but I am so happy about this place that I want to do anything I can to keep it in business.  I am absolutely thrilled that there is a boba place in the northwest. Tea Time has the familiar boba drinks, including my all time favorite of rose milk tea. They also serve a variety of snacks including peanut butter slathered on a piece of toast that looks like it's about 2 inches thick.  I tried a new flavor - peppermint milk tea. I wasn't sure if I would like it, but since the cashier talked me into it he said he'd make me a new one if I didn't like it. He was considerate and personable, and I appreciated it. It turns out that I really enjoyed the peppermint milk tea. It was refreshing and perfect for such a hot day.  I will definitely go back, especially since they have food options and wireless. They also have a frequent buyer card - buy 10 boba teas and get the 11th free.

Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: I've had the green apple tea with boba and a spam musubi(which only comes in two for some reason).  The food and boba drink tasted good but took a while to make which is why I give them 4 stars.  Would definitely come here again but not if I am in a hurry. Also service was friendly and apologized for the long wait on the musubi.

Reviews.Author: Mirella
Reviews.Content: This tea place has a large menu. I am in love with the thai tea bobas. Their boba was absolutely delicious and fresh. I gave them 4 stars because the thai tea wasn't as milky as  it should have been. Tasted a bit watery and not as strong. It was still pretty good. I'm used to having the Thai tea boba from The Quickly's in California. So I'm often comparing every Thai tea to theirs. I would still go back and try others. Overall I was satisfied with my purchase.

Reviews.Author: Sib
Reviews.Content: I'm a huge fan of their milk tea with tapioca. I've had it hot and cold and loved both. I like that they will adjust the amount of sugar in the drinks or use Splenda (if you use that stuff). Easily the most polite, friendly boba place I have been to. Kind of an out of the way location, unfortunately.

Reviews.Author: Bobby
Reviews.Content: TL;DR - Stop searching. Go here.   This place is a true gem. I absolutely love it here! I first found it because I had a dentist appointment next door and I decided to do a little exploring beforehand.   When I first walked in, I was blown away by how lovely the inside of the cafÃ© was. The outside was pretty lame and inconspicuous, but the inside is gorgeously laid out and decorated. Not something I usually care about, but you can tell presentation is important to this establishment. But that's not why I love this place.   The tea, boba and food are all excellent. Well mixed and sweetened, the drinks are affordable and delicious. So far, I have tried the Yakisoba Fries, Parmesan Garlic Fries, and the Spicy Tuna Fried Rice Balls. Food sometimes takes a little while to come out (~20 minutes) but the drink are always on time. Everything is fantastic. Good serving size, great flavor, and really filling. But that's not why I love this place.   The 2 huge reasons why I love this place are Asia and Kayla. These two sweethearts are incredibly kind and helpful and diligent. You can tell everyone that works their loves their jobs, but Asia and Kayla seem to go above an beyond. Always smiling and always attentive, they make anyone and everyone feel welcome.   11/10 will visit again.

Reviews.Author: Brianna
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite tea/ coffee shops in Northwest Las Vegas. Every time I come in the staff is very welcoming and friendly. They recently upgraded their menu and now offer even more food items. The boba teas are amazing and I've never been disappointed. They have fresh macaroons that they make in shop that are very good however you need to eat them in the morning or else they're usually gone or stale by the end of the day. They have so many different flavors and toppings it can get overwhelming, but everything I've tried on the menu so far has been great. My favorite drink is the lychee jelly taro drink. Also I've tried the chai latte, honeydew boba tea, white chocolate coffee, and milk tea.

Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: My family & I have been coming here since it first opened & I couldn't help but spread the word to many people I know. It's great to finally have a good boba place up where we live. Absolutely love their honey boba milk tea & honey dew. We've tried a variety of drinks & food here, & I can't complain about any of them. Very good sweet brick toast, tuna rice balls, & soups. Always finding our way back here.

Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Best Boba drinks I've had. Convenient and locally close to where I live. Staff are great. Great attitude and knowledgeable of their drinks and recommendations. Continue to do what you do best! I will come back again. Thank you!

Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: A great Boba place on the north side of town?? What?? Yes, it's true!!   Offers a variety of tea drinks and frapps too. They also have amazing smoothies! You can mix two flavors without any extra cost. Try the Coconut - Taro Boba. I nearly finished the whole thing within 10 mins. I like the little cafÃ©, with small couches and tables to relax. There are also some board games if you want to hang out with your friends. Love that there are also food and snack items too.

Reviews.Author: Candice
Reviews.Content: At first I was like  Yeah!!  but now I'm like  Nah... -_-   5 stars for having delicious teas. -2 stars for always being out of food options. I've been coming here since this place opened, and not once have I been able to get the fried squid jerky. I can't remember the last time my strawberry pudding tea was made correctly instead of having taro subbed in it. That stuff leaves a funky taste in my mouth. Aaaaaand the other day when I was here they were out of boba. So yeah, I'm over it and most likely will just hit up my favorite place in Chinatown the next time I want squid jerky and strawberry pudding tea.

Reviews.Author: Erica
Reviews.Content: The peppermint milk green tea here is the best drink on their menu.  It's not too sweet or bitter.  It has the perfect balance of peppermint and green tea.  What I love about this place is the alternative milk options they also have.  If you're lactose intolerant, you also have the choice of almond or soy milk.  They also sell really unique flavors of French macaroons such has Horchata and Strawberry yan yan, which are baked to perfection.

Reviews.Author: Kaylee
Reviews.Content: I love this place and that its on my side of town! The green, taro, and Hokkaido teas are my favorite! The staff is always friendly :) I haven't tried any of the food yet, but the tuna rice balls and yakisoba fries always look very good.

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: I am so happy my boyfriend and I came here! We walked in and I was a little overwhelmed by all of the choices. They all looked so good! As my head was just about to explode from so many options, my boyfriend pointed out the white chocolate milk tea. What?!*%# heaven!! I ordered it with boba and my boyfriend got the caramel green apple smoothie.  We sat down and waited for our drinks and started playing uno. It took only a few minutes of anxious waiting and uno domination for our drinks to come out. It wasn't as sweet as I expected but it really was heaven! My boyfriend loved his, I just thought it was a little too caramely. The service was awesome and the atmosphere is very relaxed. We will definitely be coming back again!! :)

Reviews.Author: Joyce Ellen
Reviews.Content: I have to give this place 5 stars, why? Because I'm almost always there! Some of the people who work there know my name and know what I want to order already. They are very friendly people and I enjoy the fact they remember their loyal customers.   I'm addicted to their Milk tea with boba. I order all the time, and they are consistent with their drinks. I never go away disappointed with anything I order. I used to get their taro milk tea with boba and their thai tea as well, but when I discovered the milk tea.. I was hooked, literally! They are so fast with getting your drink when they aren't busy. When they are busy they make the effort of perfecting your drink to make sure it came out right. I appreciate that.   I also like their reward program, when you buy 9 drinks.. you get your 10th on free! I never have my card on me, so I put in my cell phone number in the pin pad and my points go directly to my account. I also receive text messages on certain promotions. It's nice because they don't obnoxiously text you a bunch of times so you can go in and get a drink, but when you do see them pop on your phone, you just want to get their boba. Ha.  I recently tried their new Banh Mi sandwich, it was tasty! The bread was delicious and warm. It was pretty big sandwich for the price as well. I'm surprised with how much meat they put into the sandwich. They have separate prices for the sandwich or if you go there during lunch time, they have lunch specials. You get a medium drink with the sandwich for a certain price!

Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: I searched Yelp to find a place nearby where I could do a little work and arrived here on an early Sunday morning. It's empty, fast wifi, and very friendly people. I got a delicious caramel latte with almond milk and it's not too sweet at all. The girl at the counter answered my questions about the macaroons and never made me feel like I was asking too much. This is a great little get work done spot! I can't wait to arrive hungrier and try more of the food!

Reviews.Author: Silvino
Reviews.Content: Deciding to finally write a review after being a customer here so many times. Tea Time is a cool place and friendly staff. One of those establishments where you can chill with your friends as they have big enough tables to play card/board games and such. I always come here with friends and the staff are always smiling and courteous even if the friends I hang out with are obnoxious af lol. I've only really tried their smoothies. But let me tell you.... Their boba Taro and Thai Tea smoothies are A1. The only bad thing I can say is that it's a litttleee pricy.. But I won't knock off a star. Thanks Tea Time for keeping it real.

Reviews.Author: Francine
Reviews.Content: Yay finally a boba place in the Northwest side of town!   This place is a little bit hidden, at first I didn't even know that there was a boba shop in the Northwest side of town. Located near the Cracked Egg (that's how I found this place, saw the Boba sign and said HELLO). Very clean and staff is very friendly. Prices is the same as any boba shops! Many flavors to choose from which is great because it keeps coming back for more.   So far my bf and I tried the Kiwi smoothie, Green Tea Smoothie, Orange Cream, and Honeydew! Of course that wasn't all from one trip, been here about 2 times and will be back again!

Reviews.Author: Cesca
Reviews.Content: Their drinks are a hit and miss. I usually get the wintermelon milk tea and it's delicious but it tends to taste watery like I don't even know what I'm drinking anymore. Their boba is on point during the day but if you go there late it tastes old

Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: I've been here a few times and so far so good! The first time I got a honeydew smoothie with boba, and it was pretty delightful. The texture of the smoothie was awesome as well as the boba. Now, though, I'm pretty hooked on taro. I asked someone there what it tasted like and he told me that it resembles the marshmallows from Lucky Charms cereal, so I went for it. I also got extra boba and wasn't disappointed one bit! Ever since I first tried the taro, I've been trying to get something different off the menu, but I just can't. It's the perfect mix between sweet and not sweet. My younger sister got a chocolate smoothie on my first visit, and it was seriously a chocolate shake from heaven.   My girlfriend has gotten three different tea smoothies - rose, lavender, and jasmine. All three are interesting, but good! I liked the lavender the best, and she likes all three pretty equally.  We've never had to wait too long to get our drinks and the staff is very friendly and are great at answering questions and letting us know what they liked. (For example, we asked one staff member what something tasted like and she was honest in that she hadn't tried it before. I'd much prefer honesty like that over someone just saying  it's good! )

Reviews.Author: Andrea
Reviews.Content: I love this place. It's convenient, affordable, & delicious! And the people here are always nice :) I would definitely recommend this place! Boba is the bomb

Reviews.Author: Sara
Reviews.Content: Seriously some of the best boba I've had ( and I've had boba all over Vegas and LA) the boba is cooked to perfection and the menu is extremely varied and has something for everyone. The only good boba in the centennial hills area by far. My personal favorite is the blended Thai tea with extra boba.  Usually go a few times a week and the customer service is excellent!!! Drinks take a while but it's well worth it.

Reviews.Author: Rou
Reviews.Content: I've already filled two stamp sheets here and I thought it's time for an update.  This place is still AMAZING! My all time favorite is the early grey tea (called Royal milk tea).   The two guys that work here are super duper friendly and they remember your exact order if you come here often enough. They always work fast and get your drink out pretty quickly even though they usually have several customers at once.   Also I have to mention that I think the boba here is very soft. I love it!   Again: Good study place, pretty quiet and lots of seating available   Like I said before, my all time favorite place for boba in Vegas :))) I will keep filling those stamp sheets!!! Thank you Tea Time Cafe!

Reviews.Author: Taylor
Reviews.Content: I really like coming here! Friendly staff and quick service. My favorite drink is their Oreo milk tea!

Reviews.Author: Raqi
Reviews.Content: My husband & I are big fans of bubble tea, but don't love driving all the way to Spring Mountain to satisfy our craving.  So we were really excited to see a sign advertising it right near our house across from the Centennial Shopping area!  We checked it out tonight, and were not disappointed. Tea Time Cafe has an extensive menu of drinks and snacks.  It's extremely clean and fresh inside, and everyone who works there is really friendly.  We both just ordered regular boba tea this time and thought it tasted great!  We will definitely be going back in the future to try their other drinks, and maybe some of their reasonably priced snacks (especially the bento boxes and mochi ice-cream)..  As other posters here have said, the location is a bit hard to find, but we really hope it will become popular by word of mouth and stay around for us NW Vegas boba lovers!

Reviews.Author: Joana
Reviews.Content: Exemplary customer service. Endless drink options.  Boba pearls stay soft. Scrumptious foods.  Adorable decor and furnishing.  What more could you want from a boba shop? GO NOW!

Reviews.Author: Kym
Reviews.Content: This little hidden gem is great. Guys working here are so friendly and accommodating!   Great beef bowl!!!

Reviews.Author: Katrina
Reviews.Content: This is an update review. This place is always busy and even when they are not busy, they take forever to make the drinks. Another thing is they are always out of boba!! How are you going to have a bubble tea business but always run out of boba?! I love their drinks but they really need to get their crap together!

Reviews.Author: Paula
Reviews.Content: Tea time is seriously the best boba I've ever had. Not only are their teas delicious, but they're crazy friendly here! My boyfriend and I come here so often that a few of the workers that are there often know us by name and by order. They're super cool people who work there and a great variety of teas, slushes, and even some food! Any time I try a different boba place, I'm always disappointed. Just nothing like tea time. Try a Peach Raspberry black tea with boba. That's my favorite :)

Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: I got taro milk tea half sweeten.  It was nice. Any more sweetened would have been too much.  My daughter got cantaloupe because they were out of honeydew. It was WAY to sweet for my taste but most of the time melons are for me. But it was pretty!! The young lady helping and the young man that made the drinks were both very nice.

Reviews.Author: Blanca
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, tasty drinks, and reasonable prices. I'm a happy patron! I only wish they were open till midnight since I work nights and would love a boba fix to start my work day :D

Reviews.Author: Dasha
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful cup of hot honey milk tea and shared some nutella toast with my hubby :) great service and awesome selection!

Reviews.Author: Kate
Reviews.Content: Love this place: they have a loyalty program and I been going since It opened. They have great boba that's never over cooked or old. Their jelly is superior as well. They have games and stuff too if you like. Worth checking out!

Reviews.Author: Cintya
Reviews.Content: The staff is always friendly and the teas are always very good. Closer to my new apartment than Chinatown ! I like that they offer hot boba teas too!

Reviews.Author: Allessandra
Reviews.Content: YAS me and my friends come here all the time!!! sooo much to choose from i can always switch it up & it'll always be good. also love the curry fries & other fries options i was so excited when tea time introduced the fries. also tea time has board games for you to play while you drink your boba its a fun hang out place!! especially after school or whenever

Reviews.Author: Christina
Reviews.Content: Who knew such a quality boba place exists outside of china town?! The tea here tastes like actual tea, not the powder stuff most places use. My favorite is the rose milk tea, which is a drink not many places get right. Tea time, in addition to quality drinks, makes delicious snacks as well. The portion size is definitely worth the price.

Reviews.Author: Zaner
Reviews.Content: This is my hood tea spot. By hood I mean white suburban neighborhood. I've been coming a little more frequently. Usually I hit up the Spring Mtn spots. Their teas are just as good as any of those. I've had quite a few on the menu. Ordered the Macaroons last time and they were delectable treats. The atmosphere is ambient, very modern and relaxed. I dare yall to try the skill crane, I've almost won twice. I need to come hungry one of these times cause their food menu looks so good!!! Yakisoba fries!!!!??

Reviews.Author: Parisa
Reviews.Content: Finally a boba place that does it right in my neighborhood. I have literally been driving all the way to china town or suffering through badly cooked boba. No more I have found my boba home!!

Reviews.Author: Christopher
Reviews.Content: This place came up on my Yelp feed as a place that I may enjoy.  I looked through the reviews and the pictures and decided to give this place a try.  This is definitely a minimalist style food serving establishment.  There is very little decoration on the walls, which are painted a bold green.  The seating and tables are your patio variety done in white and green.  All in all, I thought there was way  too much green and I felt overloaded with the greenness of the deco.  The  specials  board which is done in multiple rainbow florescent colors that is back lit does catch your eyes, but was smudged and hard to read due to the missing letters.  I couldn't make out half of what the specials were.  The main reason I wanted to try this place wasn't for the boba style, frozen / milk tea drinks, but for the snacks that they have (or had) on the menu.  There are several pictures and reviews on this Yelp page that show their Popcorn Chicken, Beef Bowls and Ramin Noodle Soups.  I was disappointed to find that these are no longer being sold here.  She didn't explain why they were removed from the menu, but I was left with two of the other items that were left on my list of items to try.  I tried the Yakisoba fries and the Takoyaki.    Both the Yakisoba fries and the Takoyaki are similar in their toppings.  Both are topped with drizzled seasoned mayo, sesame seeds, seaweed flakes and what tasted like a salty soy based sauce which together tasted very good.  The Takoyaki are deep fried balls filled with a creamy filling that also contains what appeared to be squid.  I enjoyed both of them, but for the price of $4.95 each, I would go with the fries especially if you were to share them with someone.  There is more to go around.  The Takoyaki also comes out very hot and takes a long time for it to cool down in the center unless you open it up and let it cool before deciding to place one in your mouth and devour it.  The food was okay, but the service was a bit chaotic.  i did have to wait quite a long time for other customer drink orders to be made before my food order was started.  There were several drink orders that were placed after mine and served before mine.  What can I say?  They are drink orders, but I believe that time management wasn't successfully accomplished here when dealing with the only food order amongst a lot of drink orders.  Next time I'll come in for the drinks as they did look very well made and delicious for the price.    If you are going to order a  snack  as they call it on their menu, I would recommend ordering a drink with it as well.  You will get your drink and be able to enjoy it while you wait for your snack.  The snacks take quite a bit longer to prepare than the drinks.  All in all, I felt the price of the  snacks  were about a dollar too high for what you get.  The two that I tried were good though.  The decor of the cafe is an explosion of green with accents of black and white.  I felt like I was in a mint chocolate chip bowl of ice cream.   There was a black couch and chair off to one side of the dining area that had a coffee table that looked nice.    I did like that this place does have games, WiFi, a small bookshelf and some coin operated games.  It's a good place for kids, teens, and younger tweens.  If you have children I'm sure they would enjoy it here.  Especially if they like feeling like they are in a giant bowl of mint chocolate chip ice cream.  The service was what i would call  typical .  The cashier took my order, explained that they no longer made the items i came in for then waited while I looked at the menu in order to recognize something else I wanted.  She offered no help or assistance.   She didn't offer any suggestions.    After waiting what I felt was a long time for the  snacks  that I ordered, the person who brought out the food to the tables bypassed me completely, went over to another table and asked if the food was theirs.  I had to politely announce myself to let him know that he had the food I ordered.  He did apologize for walking passed me, set the food down and quickly went back to work behind the counter.  I do have to take into account that the place was busy with drink orders.  A lot of people were ordering what looked like the blended Taro milk tea with boba.  It was purple and did look well made, but I'll have to try their drinks another time.  When I do I will update this review, until then I hope you find this review helpful.

Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: Best damn Tea/Smoothie shop period. Great customer service! Love this place! I visit at least ounce a week if I can. Prices are comparable to Starbucks but to me well well worth it!

Reviews.Author: Janae
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best boba spot in the city! Their smoothies are made with real fruit and they are fantastic. I frequently go there for boba tea, usually before I go to work. It is always made perfectly and the staff are so friendly. My favorite tea is the white chocolate milk tea! If you haven't tried this place, you're truly missing out on something amazing. Oh, & their shrimp dumplings are the bomb!

Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: What to do when waiting for a near-by restaurant to complete your breakfast order??  Let's get some caffeine.  Hey, let's check out TTC?!  Roach on the floor aside.  The staff eventually took care of it.  Hey, it's Vegas...  Ordered up some Chai Tea and a spicy Musubi.  Originally I thought this would be just like everywhere else I have been to, but I was wrong.  They prepared the spicy Musubi in house.  Damn, was it good! They prepped and cooked the Musubi with a Sriracha sauce that was allowed to caramelize around a delicious slice of Spam.  Everything was tasty besides the ambiance but that being said, I am willing to find time to give TTC another chance.

Reviews.Author: Megan
Reviews.Content: This place is always delicious! I love the huge variety of tea you can get and the macarons are super delicious! It's never too busy and the staff is super friendly. It's definitely a nice break from monotony of Starbucks.

Reviews.Author: Mindy
Reviews.Content: The location is convenient considering I live in North Las Vegas. The drinks were good but they're overpriced. The amount you pay for a large is the same as the biggest boba drink at No.1 Boba. Except the size of a large at Tea Time is the same as a medium at No.1 Boba. And the regular sized boba should be called small, not regular. They were good but not worth it to me.

Reviews.Author: Ericka
Reviews.Content: Best boba in the NW! I always go there for a boba milk tea. Super refreshing in this psycho Vegas heat. I've never purchased (although been meaning to) the cute French Macarons, but they look delicious. Both the variety of the smoothies/teas and Macarons are plenty.    My only gripes are that it's a bit more expensive than tea places in Chinatown, and I've had a small number of drinks with soggy, over-soaked boba. All-in-all, can't complain and I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Angela
Reviews.Content: They take a while to make the food but they're good. Always order ahead of time before getting there. Otherwise, the tea is superb.

Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: I absolute love this place . Same great taste and quality like you would find in China Town .

Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: I was very happy to see a boba place on this side of town. Every time we would go to the Cracked Egg I would look to see if it was open yet. My anticipation was matched when I tried their milk tea for the first time. It didn't last more than a minute.  I have actually visited the cafe about 3 times before today. My boyfriend always lets me try whatever concoction he has and each time they have been yummy. The mango green tea with mango jelly stars was intensely flavorful and the mango coconut smoothie is good also. My standby is usually boba milk tea, however that may change here soon.   Tonight we introduced my mom to the cafe and needless to say she will be a repeat customer. She ordered the taro milk tea. I think it will be my new favorite. It was not overly sweet and I could almost say it had faint chocolate notes. I am not a big fan of sweet potatoes and most products derived from them, but this is a keeper.  I haven't tried any of the dishes on the menu but they tempt my palate as far as munch food goes. I am a big izakaya fan so gyoza and deep fried anything are right up my alley. The decor is rather simple and it's always been very clean when I visit. Everyone is very friendly and the atmosphere is relaxing. Big points for the picture menu so you have a good idea of what you are ordering.

Reviews.Author: Rhia
Reviews.Content: I would give it no stars if i could. My food was cold as well as the manager. I had such a bad time with the experience that I couldn't believe it. This place use to be so nice with fantastic employees and the food was amazing but then they took all the great things away and replaced them with crap. I use to come here all the time but hardly ever want to now. The drinks are great but not the rushy snippy people who work there. What happened?

Reviews.Author: Taylor
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this place. From the amazing drinks all down to the staff. They are very friendly & always willing to help out with you selection. I'm not much into boba myself so I stay away from that. But the teas & slushes are great. You can't go wrong with them! My favorite choice is mango/peach slush with passion fruit jellies. Delish!

Reviews.Author: Emily
Reviews.Content: Not bad I guess, it's a cute little place. I'm new to the area and was jonesing for a bubble tea so I came here since it's closest to my house. I noticed that the employees made up the orders of two groups behind me before mine which didn't make much sense to me, especially since one was a group of six and I only ordered one drink. The bubbles in my drink kept getting stuck in the straw which was weird and I've never had happen before but maybe they wouldn't if you didn't get a smoothie. I'll have to give them another chance before I make up my mind about them but from my visit it's just so so, not so horrendous I wouldn't come back but I'm not overly impressed either.

Reviews.Author: Nikki
Reviews.Content: Love this place  There is so many options of drinks and have some really yummy food. I am a huge fan of their spam musubi! They have macarons there provided by a different company in Vegas &I those are always delish! The staff is always super nice and friendly. This place is close to home and I love coming here whenever I have free time with my boyfriend and sister.

Reviews.Author: Joey
Reviews.Content: Although I absolutely love the drinks here as well as the food, the wait time is atrocious. 30 minutes to get a blended tea is absolutely ridiculous! Now that they have become the hipster hang out they need more employees or a better system to speed up the wait time. Fix this and you will be a 5 star joint.

Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: Wow!  I agree with the other yelpers that this is a fantastic find on the Northwest part of town.  It is a great option for asian inspired boba drinks, smoothies and snacks.  The food... 1.  We didn't try the famous coconut smoothie, but the green milk tea and honey milk tea were perfectly sweet with great herbal aroma of the green tea. 2.  Seasoned fries  yakisoba  style - Basically crispy fries topped with seaweed and Japanese mayo.  It is what they call  animal style.   Great on first few bites, but the mayo can get a little overwhelming. 3.  Curry Chicken Cutlet Bento box - This was not too impressive.  The breading on the chicken was on the softer side rather than being nice and crispy. 4.  Yakisoba!  Wow on the portion size and wow on the fancy drizzling of seaweed and mayo.  This was very yummy.  Noodles were nice and springy, but again, mayo can get a little overwhelming.  Conclusion:  Great tea place option on this side of town; solid 5 stars for fantastic green tea.  Food a good, but only if you don't have time to head down to Chinatown for something better.

Reviews.Author: Alice
Reviews.Content: Great bubble tea and great snacks. I wish that they used real dairy creamer instead of non dairy but I still enjoyed what I had here. Space is large and clean and the service is friendly. The guy running the register was nice and answered any questions on the menu for the more exotic items. I tried the Hokkaido milk tea and spam masubi and deep fried tuna rice balls. All were great. Would be great if they added more board games to their collection. Highly recommend this place. Also another bonus is they make their own egg pudding!

Reviews.Author: Gambit
Reviews.Content: Service is always friendly and helpful. Drinks are always refreshing and made perfectly to order. Food is superb!

Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to this place  sporadically since they opened.  There was nothing to comment on every other experience until today. I called in an order so I can pick up before I went to work. This was at six in the evening. They asked me how long until I would be there and I told them 15 minutes. So when I get there there are no drinks ready, I still have to give them my order again, and they tell me they were really busy before I came. But that's why I called the order in! I've come before to place an order for several drinks to go and have had to wait 20 minutes so I was trying to plan ahead this time . When I expressed my displeasure with the situation they kept telling me that it was because they were really busy right before. They were not apologetic at all and even told me not to come back! No problem guys! I won't be back and neither will anyone else I know!

Reviews.Author: Vanessa
Reviews.Content: I will give it 3 stars only because the staff was helpful. I have been here twice. Once I got the taro root smoothie the other time I got some mango one. It was just too icey and too sweet for me. It didn't taste natural at all. The flavors tasted too artificial for me.

Reviews.Author: M.
Reviews.Content: For those of you who live out in the suburbs and are tired of having to drive through heavy traffic towards Chinatown to satisfy your boba withdrawals, the search is over and the time has come--TEA Time, that is (buahaha, so clever). I have become a fan of Tea Time Cafe for their menu variety and price range, cafe environment, and short drive from my home.  For teas, they serve iced and iced milk. Non-tea drinks include caffeine-free pudding drinks, milk, yogurt drinks, jello drinks, and smoothies. They use real tea leaves in their tea. The owner said that their menu is still developing because (1) they just opened and (2) they do not have the tea leaves yet for some of the drinks they want to make. Thank goodness for the absence of powder mixes in my tea. I, for one, ordered iced honey green tea with boba, and it was authentic and very well-made. They also make their boba every 3 or 4 hours, so they're always fresh, chewy, and they don't get stuck in your straw. You know how you can taste the love in your drinks? Yeah. It was that kind of moment. And did I mention you have a choice of toppings for an extra 25 cents? That was new to me.  In addition to drinks, Tea Time Cafe offers Asian-fusion snacks, like sweet butter toast and calamari, and meals, such as large-portioned bentos and noodles--all of which are wallet-friendly. The full meals are the most expensive on the menu, but are priced at less than $8.00 each. I ordered the curry pork cutlet bento, and was surprised to find it came with sides: soup, two gyozas, orange slices, and assorted vegetables. I was full, and my wallet was only slightly less. Tea Time Cafe is also earth friendly, as their bentos are served in reusable and recyclable bento boxes (I kept and cleaned mine to use for lunch at work). There is also a very convenient picture menu at the register for those who are unfamiliar with Asian-fusion meals.  The cafe setting itself is very clean and relaxing. Music videos are played on a mounted flat screen at an appropriate volume, and the air inside is cool and refreshing. The earlier comment made by David N. about the ventilation being well-kept is spot on. Wi-Fi is also available and free, and I saw open outlets next to some tables for those more ancient laptops, like mine, or if your iPhone needs a quick charge. The cafe is located in a quiet area, so this place would be perfect for studying and writing papers.  Tea Time Cafe is a rare commodity in northwest Las Vegas. With prices going up everywhere else, I have to be picky about the amount of money I spend on gas and food, all while I please my fickle palette. And yet, all these problems are solved and I find myself content at Tea Time Cafe.

Reviews.Author: Silvino
Reviews.Content: It's a little shop tucked away in the side but when I walked in the inside was very nicely decorated and the staff was exceptionally nice.

Reviews.Author: Erin
Reviews.Content: ----edit----  I don't like businesses who can't keep up with demands and their popularity.  This also means they can't consistently deliver on the product they promise to deliver.  I'm leaving my old review to give credit BUT service is big for me and that includes consistency.  I moved to the other side of town and it's been awhile that I've been able to visit.  The one time I drive out of my way for some boba...no boba. If you know what's high demand in your shop then I recommend keeping up.      If I could double the stars to 10 I would:D:D:D As the boba queen, known by my friends, this is the best place ever!  The staff, service, cute spot, aaaaaand BOBA drinks -- they're all around.    Rich & Ken are the nicest people and welcomed me my first time in.  They also give you the low down on how they run things - wanna try a new drink? Don't be scared to waste your money! They'll give you a sample and if you don't like it, they'll make a new one for no additional charge.  You can also have them adjust the sweetness to your liking.  How awesome is that!  I actually saw a customer come in and want her drink remade and they were more than happy ---- unlike Starbucks who has a similar promise but the 2 times I've actually taken them up on it, I get a nasty look and the drink practically thrown back at me looking even more beat than before.    I'm a regular with the boba milk tea, royal milk tea (more flower taste), honey green tea, and rose tea.  ALL amazing.  Their flavors for everything are not overwhelming so you can finish an entire drink without feeling yucky.  Also, their boba servings are generous which is nice after paying $4-5 on a drink (Like some places only giving you literally 10pcs of boba??? You shouldn't be able to count it!!).    They also have a food menu which I still need to try.  Lots of people come through here to sip and hang out or have a nice meal with a friend.  Great atmosphere:):)  Don't forget to get your stamp cards!  Also, they can replace their sweetener with stevia or splenda -- go with stevia!! My finace had it in a taro smoothie and it was just the right flavor!!! Lalalalalalove it here and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: I frequent here often. The staff is always very friendly, and gets your order done in a timely fashion. The cafe can get quite busy on weekends, but it's worth the wait. The food is super tasty. Check out their bowls. They are a winner.

Reviews.Author: Aleesi
Reviews.Content: Just came back from my first-time visit here, writing this review while chewing on a mouthful of popcorn chicken...  This place is excellent! The first obvious reason is that there isn't any other boba/asian snacks/drinks places around the Centennial area (that I know of, I'm still pretty new to LV) so it's very convenient...  BUUUUT here are the reasons why you should get there and return again and again:  1. super friendly service! very nice young gentlemen were running the front when I stopped by. Both very helpful and made small talk with me while I was waiting for my order. 2. made-to-order food/drink (sort of). If you want a smoothie, you can actually mix flavors together! I got a Taro and Red Bean smoothie (these are usually separately flavored drinks) to satisfy my love of both delights. The best part is, if you don't like your drink (you want it sweeter, less sweet, didn't like the flavor at all, etc.) they will fix it for you or replace it with something else! 3. Tastes great! My drink (for being a combination of two different drinks) came out perfect, and my popcorn chicken was not bad.   The only complaint is that some of the chicken pieces had a bit more fat on it than I'm used to. I'm excited to return to try some other smoothie and milk tea flavors I was eyeing, and also their ramen. Hooray for Tea Time Cafe!  *note: they are also opening a location by UNLV soon with a drive-thru.  *notenote: family-owned operation :) Support!!

Reviews.Author: Ursula
Reviews.Content: Everyone has that favorite drink that they get just about everytime they visit a Boba/slush drink place and I finally found mine here and it's the Chocolate Malt drink with extra extra chocolate-no ice (ice just waters it down) and no boba. LOVE IT!!!! Tried the Yakisoba with mayo drizzled all over it- OK, one order can be split into 3- it's alot people- but at least you get alot for your money - You can have Yakisoba for breakfast, lunch and dinner.  Tried the fried Tofu-the sauce for that fried Tofu is yummers... Yep, Tea Time is still on the Hellah Yummy Sh*t path.....

Reviews.Author: Darl
Reviews.Content: I love this place. I've tried most of the drinks on the menu and I love all of them. The customer service is really nice.  The employees are really nice and the guy working at the cash register is a little cutie pie (n-no homo)

Reviews.Author: Nicky
Reviews.Content: Always friendly and helpful I have been coming here since they opened so glad to see this business bloom!  They have so many options there's something for everyone!

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS PLACE! Amazing customer service, great drinks, and awesome food! It's a gem tucked away in the North-West part of town!   Right off Ann and 95, next to the Cracked Egg.   The drinks are much cheaper and tastier than multiple boba places off West Spring Mountain! The place is always super clean and the staff is more than happy to recommend drinks or food based on your tastes / desires.   Plus all the drinks can either be made hot or cold!  IF YOU LIVE in the Northwest area part of LV, you gotta check this place out!  They have great hours and you'll always want to come back!  I'm hooked on Tea Time! :)

Reviews.Author: Irene
Reviews.Content: boba was okay but the macaroons and spring rolls where the best. I will definitely be going back there for the macaroons.

Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: I ordered more than 5 drinks to go and all of them were correct and given to me at a reasonable time span considering they were a little busy. I ordered the honey milk tea with boba and it was delicious! Their boba was cooked to a good texture. I was a little sad that I didn't have enough time to try their food. Next time!

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: The boba slush I had was amazing! They were out of the food that my fiance and I wanted, which is why we got out of bed in the first place! I really liked their cool wall of Polaroids shot with either a Polaroid 300 or Instax Mini. The employee that took my order was nice. Overall the experience was OK and the drink was great.

Reviews.Author: Trisha
Reviews.Content: Tea Time has been my go to boba place in the Northwest area since it opened. There's definitely things I miss when Richie & Ken used to make our drinks. Don't get me wrong, it's still pretty good, but today was off and I feel like we just wasted our money.  The good: my brother and I called fifteen minutes before we came in. When we got inside, our food was ready for pick up.  The off (not necessarily bad, but a bit disappointing, maybe the person was new? Who knows?): when we called, it was pretty clear what we ordered. The person taking our order even repeated our order when she gave us the total. Two thai milk tea smoothies, one with extra boba and one without. We got two peach smoothies both had boba in it. Took back the order because it wasn't right and reiterated my order, by that point, a lot more customers started coming in. Got the right drink, and both had boba in it. My brother has some weird allergy reaction to tapioca that was pretty mild at first, but over time has gotten pretty bad, so he tries to avoid it. By this point, there were too many customers, we had somewhere to be and couldn't wait for another order. Just disappointed that I paid for two drinks, only to be able to drink one.  Hoping it was just a one time thing.

Reviews.Author: Amelia
Reviews.Content: This place is a JOKE! There is nothing wrong with their drinks or food BUT they are always under staffed. We came in today and were told that they were no longer taking orders because they are so backed up due to being under staffed. We waited until they were ready to take orders again but they were out of what I wanted. I understand things run out but you should probably work on your inventory to make sure that doesn't happen. Also even if you are under staffed you need to keep the flow moving. When I walked in nothing was going on, no blenders running NOTHING. You need to take orders and make drinks at the same time. No take orders until everything backs up and then start making drinks. That is not an efficient way to work. Your drinks are awesome but not enough to wait 20+ minutes.

Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: I love this little cafe. I've been occasionally going here since I graduated High school 3 years ago. I usually get the Taro smoothie boba. I've gotten some food here too but i really enjoy their drinks more.   I like the colors of the chairs and walls here, makes me feel relaxed and makes me want to sit down aha. The people who work here are very friendly and they know how to talk to just about anyone. Sometimes when i want to get a drink it's full sometimes it is not. The price is very reasonable. and you can also get a stamp card that after 10 drinks you receive one free.  Check this place out if you want a nice cold drink if you haven't before!

Reviews.Author: Melinda
Reviews.Content: Must try their smoothies and milk teas with boba! Love this place! I always get their tuna rice balls, chocolate brick toast, & garlic fries. They also have macarons now and we tried 6 different flavors. Enjoyed all of them! Cookie butter is my favorite! Really like how the texture is soft unlike other places here. Only thing is the wait for food is kind of long...but at least we know it's made fresh! Def our number one hang out spot. ;)

Reviews.Author: Sheri
Reviews.Content: A TOTAL hidden gem in Centennial!! The folks who work here are so freakin nice! They will make you samples of anything you want and the drinks never are disappointing. I LOVE BOBA!!!! And you make think there could be no difference in a simple tapioca starch ball...WRONG!!! Go have a nice stale, tiny, hard one at Volcano tea, THEN try Tea Time's soft, melt in your mouth boba....mmmmmmm!!!!! No powdery disgusting after taste here either, everything is really tea infused and FRESH!!! SO YUMMY!!! The milk tea boba and green apple smoothie are my faves, and the mango coconut smoothie with boba and mango jelly stars in enough to make me never want to leave Vegas!! Yes, they DO take a while to make the drinks/food but it is worth the wait!!!!

Reviews.Author: Brittany
Reviews.Content: Visited this place for the 1st time on Monday. It was great! The people working there were super nice and made great recommendations. They made us a sample of our drinks and gave us a stamp card for our next visit, I will definitely be coming back!

Reviews.Author: Lance
Reviews.Content: Love me some boba. Although they ran out of peppermint for the drink I originally wanted, their milk tea boba was awesome! Very friendly service, hip environment (love the green walls and white chairs) and they have free wi-fi. I will be coming back...

Reviews.Author: Stefany
Reviews.Content: Boba? On this side of town? Yup! Located just off the highway in a hidden shopping center, Tea Time CafÃ© has a surprisingly large menu of beverages, simple sushi rolls, and snacks. Service is polite, space is decorated like a teenagers bedroom (not necessarily in a bad way), and the snacks are pretty decent.  ICED PEPPERMINT GREEN TEA w/BOBA: I could drink this stuff daily. I will likely come back specifically for this beverage and try to order it as my regular drink at other boba places. The mint is artificial tasting but it's very refreshing, boba was decent. RICE BALLS: Your choice of salmon or tuna, in a rice ball, lightly fried exterior drizzled with furikake and eel sauce. I paid the upcharge for salmon and what I received smelled like tuna and was fairly tasteless. Maybe this just isn't for me. SUSHI ROLLS: The rolls available here all seem to be simple variations of the California roll. The roll I selected had  crispy onion and tuna  but  was crab and avocado, topped with those fried bits that really aren't onions at all, along with a ton of spicy mayo. Tasted decent, portion was good for the $7 price.   If I was in the area more often, I'd probably hit this place up regularly but it's not worth going out of the way for. I'm glad I didn't encounter any of the service issues cited in other reviews, but found it odd that two out of three items seemed to be somewhat incorrect compared to the description provided on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Vanessa
Reviews.Content: Tea Time Cafe is such an awesome find on this end of town.   The cafe is tucked away from the main road and is located in a small business plaza. When I first came here, I drove right passed it and ended up at the security gate to some golf course. Yeah, so FYI: Don't do that.   Tea Time Cafe has a nice setup, and I like how there's plenty of seating and it's bright and clean. Another thing I like is the small selection of cute Japanese toys and cell phone accessories up for sale (sUpeR kAwaii!).  The drinks are pretty good and I like the flavors that they offer, like Thai Tea. If you're curious about trying certain flavors for their blended smoothies, they'll be happy to blend a few together for you. If you don't like it, you can order a new one. Great customer service right there.

Reviews.Author: S
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS PLACE!! I have been enough times that I got a free drink with my stamp card. They seem to have updated to  Five Star Rewards,  whatever that means, but I'm assuming it means they are doing well to join with some professional rewards service that you can get through the App Store? I have not tried the food yet but every time I order drinks they are superb. A great study spot or first date location!!

Reviews.Author: Liz
Reviews.Content: I finally visited Tea Time Cafe for the first time yesterday. My friend had visited it before and tried a milk tea but she said that she didn't like it.   I've always wanted to visit Tea Time Cafe for a long time because I pass by it a lot when I go out to the Sams Club.  I bought a Mango smoothie with boba and I loved it!!  I plan on visiting it again to try out other good stuff like the Mango Coconut drink and the Yakisoba fries (But without my friend).

Reviews.Author: Petra
Reviews.Content: I brought my girls here! Great service and Mango coconut boba is sooo good! I m sooo happy I didnt even have to drive to china town since its close by my house! My new  favorite place!

Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: LOVE this place!  Great selection of drinks and you can choose your sweetness.

Reviews.Author: Jenelle
Reviews.Content: So good! Boba is a little bit too sweet, but that's my fault for not adjusting the sweetness which is an option. Fast and clean place. The only boba place close to me that is actually good. I live by Aliante.

Reviews.Author: Vikki
Reviews.Content: Great place to chill with friends~~ I think their drinks are way better than Tea Station. Although the waiter there didn't recommend the royal milktea, but i surprisingly love it ^^.

Reviews.Author: Puja
Reviews.Content: Try the Hokkaido!  Delicious bubble tea - maybe not as creamy as some of the other milk teas I've had...but plenty flavorful! Would love to come back and try more of their flavors (especially with the possibility of earning free drinks)

Reviews.Author: Chrislynn
Reviews.Content: I love this little secluded spot off the 95/ann rd. For us folks out in the North/Northwest to have a spot to grab a boba or no boba (because boba isn't a name of a drink...just mochi like balls that are added as an option into your beverage) is GOLD I tell you! They serve your usual  boba  beverages such as milk tea, iced/hot teas, smoothies, slushy, lattes, and more!  I used to frequent a boba shop back home in Hawaii and always ordered a Strawberry Iced Black Tea. Upon moving here (2004) I always longed for my drink and searched the valley but to no avail. I noticed Tea Time not long after they opened when it was just the two brothers working the whole thing themselves and was excited to see they offered flavors to be mixed in with their teas! So you knooow what I had to order--sigh, nostalgia. Ever since then that's the only drink I've ordered. I used to stare at the menu as if I'm going to order something else, but no. Can't help it...I like what like. I love that the strawberry isn't some whack generic tasting syrup pump. This drink you will find bits of strawberries and the essence of strawberry is evident.  I can only give them 4 stars as much as I'd love to hit the 5...but in recent times has been the first time my drink has come out extreeeemely on the water tasting side. No strawberry flavor, not even a black tea hint. Almost as if they were running low of their black tea so they decided to dump more water. The power of dilution.    I bit my tongue a few times until this one time I had my husband return it, in which they gladly remade my drink. It turned out just the way it is supposed to be (thanks to Asia for fixing it for us...which she wasn't the one who originally mixed my drink up by the way). I'm not really a boba kind of gal so I always get half a serving of boba. If I get the full scoop my mouth grows tired of chewing which deflects the enjoyment of my beverage.   Anyway, enough about those chewy balls . They also offer food to accompany your drinks, or food to just munch on as you chill. Yakisoba fries are definitely deelish if you are acquainted to such flavor or is interested in tasting something new. I wasn't too impressed with their bulgogi banh mi simply because I didn't enjoy the way the meat was cooked. I thought the veggies were pretty skim too. The philly cheese steak was ahhhh-ite. However, it isn't a dedicated food joint as their business is about their drinks. They certainly won't disappoint you on that note. The new cookie butter smoothie, yes you read cookie butter smoothie, is addictive! Oh, and the cookies and cream smoothie....drool. I think I have gained some pounds from those smoothies. Well deserved and satisying pounds gained for that matter! You know it's good when someone completely dedicated to one drink all these years goes out her realm, goes to her weekly spot to betray her fave iced tea.   Try it out, enjoy, the staff are great, and when you walk out...you'll be thankful you yelped it.   Also note...you can mix your flavors.  I think I'm going to load up these gremlins and go for a  drive .

Reviews.Author: Eunice
Reviews.Content: I got a strawberry smoothie with lychee jelly and a peanut butter and jelly macaroon. Staff was awesome, just sad they didn't have any decaf tea options. They also only had like 3 macaroons left, not too many choices. The smoothie was extremely sweet, however their fries were amazing!!!

Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Great boba right here. Got their Thai tea and it was good. Not powdery like other places. Drinks and food came out pretty quick. We ordered the takoyaki to go with the drinks. Yummm. Definitely coming back here for my future boba needs.

Reviews.Author: Cassandra
Reviews.Content: Tea Time Cafe popped my Boba cherry. Everyone is always  Boba this  and  Boba that . I was curious on what all the fuss was about. The verdict: Plain ol' boba doesn't have any flavor, but mainly serves to add texture to your drink - I'm not really a fan because I want to slurp down my delicious tea without impediments. Basically, I don't want my ferocious pace of slurping interrupted by chewy Boba balls that I would probably choke on lol. I don't have time to chew!!  On my first visit, I asked the cashier for a recommendation on something sweet. I went with an Iced Chai Milk Tea. This drink is divine!! If I could drink it everyday, I could. Meanwhile, I just daydream over this drink and fantasize about my next trip to Tea Time to get another Chai Milk Tea. There's a million drinks on the menu but I just can't get enough of the Chai Tea. What if I order something else and it's not as good?? I'm addicted.  My husband gets something new every time. To each his own! We both love the macaroons here, but if you want some, come early because they get wiped out quickly. The fruity pebbles flavor is great!   VIBE: There's boardgames on hand and the tables accommodate groups of people, so it's a great hang out spot. Top 40 music plays in the background.    PRO TIP: Tea Time has a loyalty card and a text message program. Sign up for discounts!   Worth a Return Visit?  That would be a definitive YES. The employees are friendly and the drinks are amazing.  YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #80

Reviews.Author: Johnathan
Reviews.Content: I went in 15 after closing time and they chased me down and made my drink for me!!! I really didn't know what I wanted and asked them to just do it at random and the drink was really good  thank you guys for the drink and the kindness! Really hope anyone who reads this stops by

Reviews.Author: Carla
Reviews.Content: I'm really glad I found this place. Not many decent Boba spots in North Vegas. This one always delivers. Great variety of boba & tea. Even the food is good and portioned just right for a quick snack. Such friendly service. They always seem so patient with me while I'm taking forever to figure out what I want to order. My only gripe: it's always a bit too warm for me inside. I wish they'd turn up the air conditioning just a tad more.

Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: I love this place, the staff is super friendly and helpful and everything I have tried I have loved. Im a regular and I try something new almost every time I come in. Portions are very generous as well, my ramen bowl was huge! This place puts me in a good mood each time I go.

Reviews.Author: Kara
Reviews.Content: Amazing staff, quick service, and lots of tea combinations. Anything from milk teas to blended smoothies! Also delicious ramen is served here. If you are unsure what to order just talk with the staff and try will help you find the perfect drink to satisfy your tastebuds!

Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: Delicious iced lychee green tea. This place is my new favorite study spot. They have wifi, yummy drinks, and affordable little snacks. The staff is super friendly as well.

Reviews.Author: Terri
Reviews.Content: We finally made it to this well-reviewed boba spot/cafe.  It's been a bookmark of mine for quite some time and I am happy to report that it lives up to the rave reviews.  Located right off the 95 and Ann Rd in the northwest, Tea Time Cafe has many choices for its guests, from boba drinks and smoothies, to Spam musubi and ramen.  I chose the small size avocado smoothie with boba and lychee jelly.  I asked the nice man taking our orders what went well with avocado and boba and he recommended the lychee jelly; I'd never had that before.  Sweetness level can be adjusted according to your liking here with Stevia and Splenda available as substitutions.  Actually, they can customize your drink in most any fashion, so the sky's the limit.  I'll come back soon and try the Spam musubi and a different boba combination.    *Closed Tuesdays

Reviews.Author: Katricia
Reviews.Content: Great smoothies and excellent service.  Nice quiet location with large round tables, perfect for study groups!!  The Mango smoothie is absolutely delicious.

Reviews.Author: Juju
Reviews.Content: I'm a bit biased to this place since I know the owner, but I feel like the place has really gone down over the years (I'm not sure if it's still owned by the same person now). It seems as though every time I come here, they're always out of something or it isn't as consistent as before.   Anyways for my most recent trip, I got the coconut milk tea and takoyaki. And I have to say that I give the coconut milk tea a 1 out of 5. I did not taste the coconut AT ALL. It just tasted like regular milk tea, even though I tried so hard to search for the coconut flavor in it. It just wasn't there. I've gotten better drinks before, so this one was a miss for me.   Takoyaki orders usually come with 6 pieces but they gave us an extra one because it was their last pack apparently, which was really nice. I'd say it's a 4 out of 5. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't the best takoyaki of my life either. Anyways, this place is still a decent boba spot, but I wouldn't recommend driving out of your way to get here.

Reviews.Author: Nicolette
Reviews.Content: Came in here with my sister about a month ago, it's not a place that stuck to my memory as horrible, but nothing that I would want to return to here. The cashier was snappy and impatient with us when we ordered. (We were the only people in the store, what's the rush?) It was my first time at the cafe, and the cashier had no recommendations or offered no help in selecting anything off the menu, so it was sort of a quick pick-whatever-sounds-cool off the menu game for me.  We waited about 15 minutes for two blended drinks, all the meanwhile two other customers came in and received their order before ours. They had food and had ordered and paid at the cashier, so I'm assuming this wasn't a pre-order of some sort that was called in before time. What gives with that?  I got a rose milk drink that was blended. It tasted alright, but it was mostly ice and it wasn't long before all the milk and flavor was gone and I was left with half a cup of mushy ice. Bleh.  Not the worst place I've been too, but the lackluster service and mediocre drink will prevent my return here.

Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: Looooove. Who knew Las Vegas boba could be so good?  Andrew J. and I stopped by here after half a day of climbing at Red Rocks. It couldn't have been a better plan! I had a peach milk tea and he had a mango milk tea. These weren't on the menu, but they can make any tea into a milk tea. The teas were perfect--just a hint of sweet, a touch of milk, and a wonderful light froth. The boba was yummy and chewy too. And the top it off, the service was amazing, the man working there was genuinely kind. We really wanted to stop by here the next day, but unfortunately Tea Time closes really early!  Verdict: Completely worth the 15 minute drive from the strip--heck, I'd drive 30 minutes! You will have no regrets.

Reviews.Author: Sierra
Reviews.Content: Yum. I really enjoyed the yakisoba fries, and the portions are large for the price. A clean, simple atmosphere. I love it!

Reviews.Author: Natalie
Reviews.Content: Deeeelicious smoothie, tea, and macarons. I've been meaning to stop by here since they've opened and somehow only made my way to Tea Time Cafe a week ago. I just didn't know what I was missing, considering they're like 5 minutes away from me!  The cafe offers a pretty good selection of beverages like fresh teas, smoothies, frapps, even some made with greek yogurt. They have a selection of eats, honestly did not look at the menu but I am planning to try the Yakisoba fries and Brick Toast next time I'm here. Just talking about it makes me want to go back...  Their macarons are SOOOOO good! I tried Ube, Green Tea, and Hazelnut. All perfectly light and flavorful. The mango matcha smoothie with jelly was everything and friend's blueberry mango, and strawberry iced green tea was delicious as well.  WHYY did I wait so long to come here??? Beats me. But they've definitely earned a return costumer.

Reviews.Author: Chevy
Reviews.Content: The day I came in for a boba smoothie, they didn't seem to be busy, but for some reason, the service was exceptionally sloooooow. I didn't think the drinks were any better than what I've had before, so I don't understand what all the buzz is about. I don't think I'll be back.

Reviews.Author: Terra
Reviews.Content: This place just gets better and better. I've been a regular customer here for over a year and I don't plan on stopping. The food here is fantastic. I especially adore the Yakisoba fries and the Gyoza. Both are delicious and aren't greasy at all.  And don't even get me started on the drinks! From the Milk tea (yum peppermint white chocolate) to the new Cookie Butter Chai, there are no bad flavours!

Reviews.Author: Katherine
Reviews.Content: This was my first time trying boba! I went with my usual iced chai tea and it was so refreshing.

Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: I freaking LOVE this place! We used to live in the NW part of town, and were regulars here. The Almond Milk Tea with boba is one of the best things I have ever drank! Sadly, we have now moved to the SW side of town, and miss this place tremendously, as nothing down here even comes close. Whenever my fiance golfs at Painted Desert I make him bring me back tea from here. Please open another spot down here, or in Henderson!!! ASAP PLEASE!

Reviews.Author: Brittany
Reviews.Content: What a great little spot for boba tea! Before I knew about this place I would drive all the way to Chinatown to get my boba tea fix, but now whenever I crave it I can just come here instead! The girl working was very sweet, and the place has plenty of tables if you want to sit in there and enjoy your boba. A little hidden gem in the northwest!

Reviews.Author: Kathleen
Reviews.Content: This spot is my favorite boba drink spot!! My children love this place. We used to live around the area but we moved on the other side of town but it doesn't keep us from coming to this side of town to get some boba drinks! We been to many other boba spots but this place is our favorite! Their Yakisoba fries are so good!
